Witty, irreverent, gloriously entertaining it's a no-brainer that this gets 5-stars from me.I said in my review of "Nomadland" that although that wasn't a 5* film for me, I could see why its brave and different slant at film-making earned it the Best Film Oscar. Well, almost regardless of what epically beautiful production Pixar might bring out before the end of the year, if the Academy doesn't vote this Best Animated Feature at next year's Oscars, then some sort of crime might have been committed.(For the full graphical review, please check out One Mann's Movies on the web or Facebook. Thanks.)
Loved this movie start to finish! A must watch with the family or for anyone! The animation is so cool and we loved the little details and comic book feel. Will definitely be watching this again.

reviews.review_title: A dangerously hilarious War of the Worlds
reviews.content: A dangerously hilarious War of the Worlds-2001: A Space Odyssey-Jurassic Park-James Bond-The Avengers-Marvel's Avengers-Indiana Jones-The Incredibles-I, Robot-Meet the Robinsons-The Matrix-Kill Bill-The Croods-The Gremlins artistic combo.

reviews.review_title: Good for families and young people
reviews.content: Bad for adults without kids: the pace is like a sugar filled toddler bouncing off the walls and feels like you're stuck in endless loop of bad Instagram stories. I don't give a damn for memes, gifs, or terrible music remixed by Rihanna making it equally terrible. All that being said, it hits its target audience perfectly! Gen Z will fall in love with it's hyper active antics, over the top voice talents, and action packed (albeit terribly cliched) storyline. It's not very original from either a sci fi adventure or coming of age perspective. The going away to college/family tension story arc was predictable. I don't understand why it's always gotta be the dad who doesn't "get" or support his kid, where are all the awesome dads in these films? Also, I really wish that story tellers would endeavor to teach our future generations that education isn't everything and you won't always get the job that you go to school for. I realize most will scoff at it, but the dad encouraging his daughter to have a back up plan should've been more than just his disbelief in what she does. This should've been discussed further as a family unit, to demonstrate the realities of post secondary education and life itself. It wouldn't have hurt for both parents to say, "yeah, you like to make movies, and we hope you're successful at it, but if it doesn't pan out *we're* here for you." Instead kids will think parents just plain don't "believe in them" when they say they want to grow up to be professional TikTok influencers... It's clear the filmmakers just wanted to make a fun, cutesy, geeky movie for Gen Z, but I wish they had given more depth and a stronger message behind all the fun.

The animation in this movie is nothing short of exceptional! With striking details in every scene and a vibrant editing style, this cartoon is a standout within its genre. The story is a tad predictable, but it also sends a nice message about having your family's back!

They nailed the style they went for. It's energetic, original at times (outside of done foundations, but what isn't nowadays?), and most of it is memorable. There's a lot of heart in it, and I'd be surprised if someone on the mindset to watch it, doesn't enjoy it.Felt like an entire season of a show crammed into 2 hours. It's surprising what good writing can do! From emotion, to character arcs, to spot-on comedy beats. And of course, artistically incredible! Models, effects, the included drawings.. all of it! One of the best looking animated movies.

reviews.review_title: Such a quirky family ZOMG XD
reviews.content: Just old men who don't understand the internet trying to make their fears and insecurities contagious... A film about fathers who don't know how to apologise or connect with their children.

reviews.review_title: Netflix just stepped their game up.
reviews.content: I wasn't expecting a cinematic movie on a streaming platform. This movie was grade a from beginning to end. I loved the cast and the thing that really drove it was the father and daughter moments. It didn't feel written in at the last minute, it was used as a story arc and successfully so.I would have chosen an actual kid for the youngest Mitchell child, but I got what they were going for.

Okay, I guess I said too much in my first review.After reading other reviews on other sites, I guess this does have generally strong appeal to groups like family and kids. It's a movie for happy families, not some single bored adult, hence all the high positive ratings.I watched it because almost all the YouTube reviewers said positive things about it. They're hit and miss but I trust them most of the time when they say something is good. So I took a peek and was immensely disappointed by the writing, characters and plot. The visuals are great as they all say. I'm going to have to accept the fact that it just wasn't for people like me.

reviews.review_title: NOT AS FUN AS I HOPED
reviews.content: "The Mitchells vs The Machines" isn't as fun as I hoped (due to great reviews from critics and rotten tomatoes) but it is still a pretty funny film with hilarious commentary on humans' dependence on technology.
I think this animation movie is one of the best in the past few years in this category. It is really good and funny, the special effects are awesome.
So moronic and cliche that it's actually funny (sometimes).Not for kids, even being an animation movie.My 2 cents.

reviews.review_title: HILARIOUS FUN!! Hahahahaha The END is NIGH!!!! :O
reviews.content: Been waiting like 2 years for this. So much Fun for the whole family and The Dog is a Star!! :D I remember reading books about this happening as a kid, and now with all our tech reliance, this is a fun way to see how Screwed we will ALL be in the VERY NEAR future!! Better watch it now, BEFORE it becomes OUR REALITY! ;D.

reviews.review_title: "Dog, Pig, Dog, Pig, Loaf of Bread."
reviews.content: Breathing new life into animated visuals with it's creative and impressive art style, MITCHELLS VS THE MACHINES is a giant furby filled explosion of madness that the whole family will adore!P. S. Aaron... ring me! Ill talk about dinosaurs all day long!

reviews.review_title: A must-see family entertainer that is funny and thought-provoking at the same time!
reviews.content: I know I'm a bit late to the party on this one and what a party it was! The Mitchells vs the Machines is a ridiculously fun and thought-provoking satire on how humanity has become over-reliant on technology, so much so that a simple dinner conversation with your family has become a rare occurrence.Abbi Jacobsen voices Katie, a teenage misfit who tries to keep her weird family together during a robot uprising. Danny McBride voices her technophobic dad who strives to get his children more in touch with nature and wildlife.What ensues is a delightful romp full of laugh out loud moments, life lessons and several questions posed to the audience on where do we draw the line between using technology to better our standard of living vis-à-vis losing touch with those most close to us.Maya Rudolph, Olivia Colman and Mike Riando voice the other supporting characters with elan and the quirky, edgy animation is an absolute masterclass.The music from Mark Mothersbaugh is uplifting and energetic and excellently gels with the narration, and you are sure to be humming the theme well after watching the film.For the whole family this one! Highly recommended!

Summary:Mind-blowing, creative and adrenaline-pumping narrative roller coaster about a family that is forced to face a planetary rebellion of robots and other machines (with an unthinkable leader), in the very heart of Silicon Valley, with an enormous visual display, an unbeatable humorous timing and ironic criticisms of connectivity, virtual assistants and online life as a panacea. An up-to-date warning about the dangers of computer fascism.Review:Katie lives with her parents and her younger brother. She gets accepted to a film school, but her father cancels her plane flight and decides to take her to school by car with the whole family. In the middle of the journey they are surprised by a world rebellion of robots commanded by an unthinkable leader (voiced by Olivia Colman).Few doubt that, for some years now, the best scripts and the most creative ideas have been largely provided by animated films. And as in this case, they also endow their characters with a complexity and humanity often absent from their flesh and blood counterparts.In this film, the family dynamics in the face of the crisis that it must face is very well developed: its members learn to know and respect each other and to redefine their roles. There is a vindication of the family that does not look conservative but rather as a collective and overcoming reconstruction and not as compliance with the previous status quo.But undoubtedly, the strength of this Michael Rianda and Jeff Rowe film is the mind-blowing, creative and adrenaline-pumping narrative roller coaster about this family (not forgetting their dog, the protagonist of a recurring hilarious conceptual gag) that is forced to face this rebellion. World of robots and other machines in the very heart of Silicon Valley, sporting a huge visual display (combining various animation effects), unbeatable humorous timing and ironic criticism of young computer geniuses and the bidding software vs. Hardware and connectivity, virtual assistants and online life as a panacea. And an updated alert about the dangers of computer fascism.To see on the biggest screen you have.

This was one of the best Netflix films from recent years. The film doesn't have subliminal advertising, it has no forced in jokes so it doesn't annoy us when there is a funny moment and it had a nice long run. What more could you ask for the best f 2021?

Saw the trailer for this and thought I'd give it go without having many high expectations. I'm very glad that I did watch it. The best animated film of 2021 so far. The animation, story, and music all are brilliant. The characters as individuals are ok but as a collective (as a family) they work so well together. It's a fun, chaotic film that is for kids and adults to enjoy. I highly recommend it.

The Mitchells vs the Machines is the funniest animated movie I've ever watched. The movie reminds me of the Lego Movie, because this movie is from the studio that brought you The Lego Movie. The Mitchells are up against the alien invasion of app technology of robots, and it's literally the best storyline of all time full of adventures to save the world and brings the best animated comedy for last!

reviews.review_title: Warm family movie, but classic Hollywood moves but with innovative elements
reviews.content:
So traditional Hollywood style the jokes, the action the story and even the music choice
Pity another robot is taking over the world and children are growing up
Do like how they apply the classic jokes into new jackets, new executions
The amount of effort they do try to put everything together and innovativeness.

The first and the second act are fine. However the third act is so lame and generic that ultimately ruined the movie for me and that's a shame because until that point I was enjoying it. A family of imbeciles facing thousands of robots and defeating them is really stupid even for a kids movie. Moreover, focusing so much on the father-daughter bond and the misunderstandings between them was also really tiring and oveplayed. Lord and Miller improved this movie with their involvement, without them it would be like the other unwatchable Sony Pictures Animation movies. All in all I expected this animated movie to be special because of the high rating but that's not the case, it had potential but it disappointed me in the end.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I have seen in a long time
reviews.content: It helps immensely that we were able to watch this as a family with a 7yr old. The story is great, great writing and character development. It's the animation that really wins the day. It is fun and quirky. It reminded me of Scott Pilgrim Saves the World but totally animated.The story is pretty heart warming. A typical quirky family with typical problems trying to work through their issues when the end of the world falls upon them and they are the only ones who can stop it.It is similar to Spiderman: into the spiderverse, in intensity. But this one is far more funny. Total recommend.

No one is perfect. No family is perfect. But that (and the weirdness) is what makes them beautiful. Lots of things here might not make sense or might make you wonder if it is an actual film. That is because this movie is no ordinary film. This movie is one of the most ambitiously exaggerated (and weird) film I've ever seen.'The Mitchells vs. The Machines' is an animated film about family. It may take you to artsy weird films, humans-loathing machines (wholly called Pal), even a human ripping a mechanical heart out of an advanced robot; but what's worth watching is the love the Mitchells have for each other, and their weirdness, of course. Every family is weird, if you ask me, in their own unique way. Do you want to see a colourfully animated and berserk family film? Then, you know what to watch.
I like how the family would have a machine battle. It's very exciting to see. This is The Emoji Movie, but way much better.
My 6, 10 and 11 year olds were rolling on the floor laughing! Sitting there as a 34yr old mom, I was actually into it too when I didn't even mean to get sucked in. A really great movie.

reviews.review_title: Monotonous, tedious watch of high decibel fury
reviews.content: This movie is one heck of a roller coaster ride and so loud, wild, crazy and wacky that it is an extremely difficult task to sit through it for the one hour 53 minutes of running time. All sound and fury signifying nothing. I am really surprised at the popularity this movie has achieved. I recommend that you see it in installments of 20 minutes or so or maybe less if your head starts spinning earlier. It's like sitting through a " Tom and Jerry " cartoon for nearly 2 hours. I have nothing against animation movies. In fact I have recently seen " Encanto" and " Raya and the last dragon " both well made, lovely, interesting movies focussed on peace, togetherness and family values. This movie tries to project family values but the focus is on the fast and furious battle between an American family and robots as each group attempts to establish supremacy. Mr Mitchell, mom Linda, teenaged daughter Katie, her little brother Aaron and the doggie are all hyper and desperate all the time. The humans behave like robots and the robots are trying to become humans. Even this premise is okay but the loud, wild and garish way the director has gone about presenting the plot keeps you disturbed rather than entertained. There are intermittent attempts at projecting humor but each time it falls flat. A simpler plot without the excessive action would have worked really well. The opening scenes of the lady in the Columbia logo shaking up gives you an idea of what will follow and it surely happens. Scene after scene of deafening soundtrack, mayhem and destruction follow in quick succession which would please kids of age group 6-10 years or young adults of similar IQ. Sample what Mr Mitchell says " The Mitchell's are weird and that's what makes us great. So let's go and save the world ". Even Arnold Schwarzenegger didn't have to do so much to save the world. The four stars are for the hard work put in by the technicians.

Indie vibes and art work making the film colourful and fun to watch, great soundtrack had us all laughing and crying throughout the film. Definitely one my children will want to watch over and over again.

reviews.review_title: 'You know how to say 'I love you' in moose language?'
reviews.content: This is such a beautiful movie in every way! The Mitchell family are comprised of Katie (Abbi Jacobson), her dad Rick (Danny McBride) her mum Linda (Maya Rudolph), her brother Aaron (Michael Rianda who also directs here) and of course their incredible pug Monchi. In an effort to rekindle family spirit and stay close while Abbi is away for university, Rick enforces the idea of a long bonding road trip to the uni. During this time, they have to bond together more than ever when a robot apocalypse threatens to exterminate humanity!From the very beginning to the end, it's a massive warm hug of a movie that is profoundly relatable with a genuinely investing family unit at the heart of the story. You're there with them through every heartfelt moment; the storytelling is so perfect that you instantly feel at home with these characters from the start. The humour is just... chef's kiss is all I can say! Monchi is an incredible animated creation!The animation is quite unlike anything I've seen before; it's beautifully unique and really eye popping! Written and directed by Michael Rianda and Jeff Rowe, it's a story told with bursting passion for cinema and a labour of family love from each crew member (the end credits are so sweet!)

reviews.review_title: Never written a review for a movie!
reviews.content: Sorry for my spelling but english isn't my first language. This is far the best animated movie in 30 years. It is great to watch, the humor is superb and don't get me started on the meme potenial gifs. A must watch!

I saw this recommended on another site so I thought I would check it out. I no longer pay for Netflix, but I use my family's account from time to time.So I remember now why I canceled my subscription.... Nothing has changed since I left....this is a Wokeflix animated movie.... It had its moments but then the they had to throw their Wokeflix agenda in the mix which kinda ruins it...4/10.

Ok this is what animation should be
like ... this is it this is why animation existed in the first place i think people start to forget how beautiful can animation be
and this is a "Reminder"
i recommend this beautiful piece of art to all humans around the world :)easy 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Thank you Netflix!!! Finally something GOOD!!!
reviews.content: Seriously. It feels like Netflix gives crap for months and then suddenly starts releasing winners again.This animated GEM from Sony Animation Studios was brilliant!!! Funny!! Heartfelt!! Awesome!!! Fun!!! Honestly it was most fun movie since Kong vs Godzilla!!In hindsight this movie would have been huge at the box office had been released to theatres. But of course a thing called a pandemic ruined that dream. Regardless watching it at home was good enough for now.Highly Recommended!!
One of the best animated graphics I've seen in a long time. But it wasn't that special for me personally. The story was cliché, but inspirational, though. The plot was well-executed.

... to see a different approach than the same old boring empty stories and same facial expressions Disney and Pixar bring us for years. This movie was fantastic. Our family loved it. And...guess what it doesn't cost 25 bucks to see it on Dislike+ . Way to go Netflix!
I haven't laughed this hard about a movie for a while. If the movie was like 15 minutes shorter, it would've gotten a 10. Absolutely must see.
Great film for entertainment. Good animation, something new, Good family film.

reviews.review_title: An incredibly fresh use of familiar ingredients.
reviews.content: Sure, this story takes plot points and character beats from the dozens of sci-fi and family comedy films that came before it. But this is proof that you can take old things and create something thoroughly unique, hilarious, ambitious, and thoughtful in spite of the tropes and contrivances.It isn't perfect, but it's so sweet, so fun, so efficiently-written, and so action-packed that any minor complaints seem to fall by the wayside.This has been a stellar year for animated films.

Produced by the talented duo of Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, the movie retains some of the craziness and inventiveness of the films that they write/direct (like the both excellent "The Lego Movie" and "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse"), but the lack of artistic involvement in this one can be felt. Even when the film has a great sense of humour, excellent animation and it's always fun, it falls into a very predictable and conservative plot; with the classical American defence of the family and the expected roles and arches of all the members of it. It was very good, but I was expecting even more.

reviews.review_title: Three Stooges Comedy Meets Woke Culture
reviews.content: Two facets of culture, the comedy stylings of the Three Stooges, and Woke Culture meet. Although diametrically opposed to each other, they prove surprisingly complimentary, if not equivalent.This will mostly be appreciated by young children and those who are politically correct but are unfamiliar with the Stooges. Sony is cashing on this phenomenon but it will likely only make headway in the North American marketplace. The anime is in no way comparable with world artistic standards, being mostly boring and bland. The music isn't much better. It will meet American storytelling standards though. It's a study in and of mediocrity. Six stars might be a little too high.

This movie is an emotional rollercoaster. The animation is amazing and beautiful, the story makes you smile, cheer, and cry. You'll enjoy every minute of this movie. It should be winning awards. Go watch it.
Yes this is obviously aimed at children but it's still very enjoyable for adults too. I found myself laughing more than I thought throughout this.
This was a cute movie! The animations were super cool, the plot was relatable, movie was funny. Definitely a cute family movie!

I'm generous in the ratings, cuz I didn't completed it. Otherwise it was a Six.Columbia productions, animated feature.Left it midway. Unable to charm.I guess it's hard to emulate, pixar and Disney who somehow manages to create magic which is both for adults and children.I think, it's a decent one for kids. And if it's decent for them, what's in it for us.
If you liked spider Man into the spider verse you will enjoy this.. The animation is great, the story is engaging overall a great film.
Brilliant film all round. Full of fun and adventure, with plenty of laughs I thought it was very funny. Well recommended for everyone no matter what the age, full of adult humour.

The Mitchell's Vs The Machines is a 2021 family animated film from Sony Animations. They made Spider-Man Into The Spiderverse back in 2018 which won best animated picture. They then partnered with the same people who made The Lego Movie to make this picture. It was supposed to come out a while ago as did most and it was supposed to be named Connected. That is just an interesting bit of information.The Mitchell's Vs The Machines is about a family who is growing farther apart by the improvements of technology. In fact, they families oldest child, Katie (Abbi Johnson) is heading off to college. The family decided to go on one last family road trip. At the same time, the leading tech company is releasing a robot that does everything for you. The machines then override the programing and begin to take humans captive. The Mitchell's then become the only family left and they must work together to save the world.This film was somewhat of a pleasant surprise. I didn't think it was going to be all that good. I was happy to find out it was just a blast. It was actually funny! That is hard to find while watching a family movie now. Most movies seem to think bodily functions will always make you laugh no matter what. It is incredibly annoying. This film did have some of that towards the start but for the most part it sort of poked fun at some family experiences. Sort of like what The Great Outdoors did but for families with younger kids to watch. There were a bunch of scenes that got some good laughs out of me, not chuckles! The story was also fairly creative. It did in the end come to where you thought it would go but the way it started was pretty different.The voice acting was nothing out of the ordinary everybody did a pretty good job. They had some SNL guys like Beck Bennet and Fred Armison voicing some robots. Also Olivia Coleman from The Crown also had a voice acting credit. The dog in the movie was voiced by Dug The Pug. I didn't even know they gave dogs voice acting credits. It was a pretty big cast of voice actors so it would have been pretty hard for the voice acting to be anything below good.The animation style was a little different from your typical computer generated animation. They blended in some real images along with some classic animation. Some times the classic animation would make the film look a little weird just because of the stuff they did with it but for the most part it was pretty cool.The Mitchell's Vs The Machines was a fun family film with plenty of good laughs and a somewhat new story. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to sit down and watch a funny film.
You may not feel complete after watching full movie but if we consider the entire package it has everything but not in depth. Overall a good movie. Give it a try with your family.

reviews.review_title: Katie is an abhorrent spoiled brat....
reviews.content: For some reason the main character is deeply unpleasant, she is desperate to get away from a family that love her, care for her, furnish her with lots of electronics and a comfortable lifestyle."Oh but my dad doesn't get the internet"Big deal?You hate him because he can't use YouTube? How shallow and ridiculous are you to have that as your main drive in life.Despite the fact the lead teen is deeply unpleasant and needs the taste slapping from her mouth, the rest of the film is pretty entertaining. The social commentary and such is ultra modern, watching this movie in a few years will be interesting.The animation is fantastic, though the weird application of sticker like social media filters etc is a bit jarring.Kids will like it.Katie is horrible, use her to teach your kids what not to grow up like.

reviews.review_title: Feels like it's never going to end
reviews.content: It's definitely over the top, way over. Felt like the movie was coming to a wraps then checked the time and it was barely half way.The animation is definitely the highlight of the movie but even that gets drowned out by the superimposed animation. It's like they made it and then gave it to a child YouTuber and then added every filter know to mankind.They just crank the characters traits to 11 to avoid any character development. The message they are trying to send is nice but it's just too drowned out by everything else. The boys character is literally 'likes dinosaurs too much'. If anything movies like these make kids feel like they should be ashamed for being different. The parents just gave up on their kids only to require the end of the world to find the motivation to reconnect with their kids.The most annoying part is the stupid dog. It's not even a good comic relief animal trope. The entire movie hinges on this character as well making it even more annoying.

reviews.review_title: Cute, some choices a bit odd
reviews.content: This is a good movie to sit down and watch with your own dysfunctional family. Unfortunately my "Katie" was off chatting with her online friends in her room, and my "Aaron" was watching with one eye on the movie and one on Minecraft. Sigh.There were some really hilarious parts. The studio did great with animating some of the characters (family dog is amazing), but other animations just didn't fit, like the dad's legs. And what TOTALLY didn't fit was Aaron's voice. He looked like he was about 8 but talked like he was about 15 or 16. Not sure who made that casting choice but it was super distracting.Other than that, great movie illustrating this crazy, digital world we have now and definitely a fabulous play on the inevitable consequences of it!

reviews.review_title: An animated "I, Robot/Terminator" movie for the whole family!
reviews.content: Fun, silly, and creative! The quirky Mitchell family is going through it's growing pains with an out of touch dad, loving but eccentric mom, and two unique kids trying to navigate who they are and who they want to become. As Katie prepares to leave home for film college, dad Rick tries to get the family to reconnect by pushing the whole family, beloved ditzy dog included, into taking a road trip. Their bonding journey is suddenly interrupted when a tech guru's robots decide to take over the world and the Mitchell's have to find a way to pull together to save their family and all humankind. Although the film can be a bit hyper and cheesy at times, it has a brightly animated, comic book look, is cleverly written, and well acted, with some good old nostalgia thrown in, as well as some moral messages about how tech can interfere with relationships, the importance of family (even a dysfunctional one), and seeing things from another person's perspective. Kids will love it, but it's enjoyable enough for adults too, IMHO! -- 6.7 stars 12/2021.

reviews.review_title: Animated movies seem ruined beyond hope, this is no exception
reviews.content: Is someone planning for the kids of today to live in some sort of violently colored plastic barf universe, in the future?! Because visually, this is what the current horrendous animations lead us to believe... the characters are made like rubber caricatures, the colors are never natural, maybe only in some hallucinations they'd look like that... they move as if bouncing around, they talk like they scream, but try to make it fake - polite. Just NO! Then the same inane people, complaining that kids and youngsters are failing at this, that and the other... Nope, you do not have the right to complain about the things that you triggered, when turning the entire universe of kids literature, movies and games into some zany visually displeasing noise - all on this line and in this style is very much aggressive, it is an act of aggression for the mind, eyes and soul.Could not watch but a small part of it, and it is a wonder we even tried, considering how these visuals in animation are clearly a bad sign since years ago, when they went over the top, destroyed anything else abd declared dictatorship.Does it even mattter what the plot is? When the animation is unwatchable?! If it matters, that too is forced and stupid...

The Pal Cell Phone was screaming and frustrating on table...that was funniest scene! I feel like 2021 is great start for 2020s decade. I can finally enjoying the present instead of dwelling in the past.

reviews.review_title: Perfect movie for the whole family.
reviews.content:
If you liked:
Gravity Falls
Ladybird
Life is Strange (videogame)Finally, a quality animation. Not only it is brought to you by Sony Animations, the studio that made the Oscar-winning "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse" 3 years ago (their first project after the Oscar); it was also directed by the creative director of the first season of "Gravity Falls" and written by the writer of it's second season. The sole creator of the "Gravity Falls" show Alex Hirsch worked as a story consultant on this film, and you can really feel the Gravity Falls influence in the signature pacing and crazy humor of "Mitchells".Like all greatest animations, "The Mitchells and the Machines" is a very childish yet a very adult film. The Mitchells, possibly the weirdest family in the world, finds themselves in a position where they are humanity's only hope in overcoming a sentient robot apocalypse. You know, the usual. The main theme of the movie though isn't so much the robots, but the relationships the family has - to each other as well as to the outside world. We have a teenager girl who feels insecure and isolated because of her unusual interests, the age-old problem of finding your tribe. We have a dysfunction father-daughter relationship where both can't seem to understand each other and find a way to talk about it. We have a mother that tries her hardest to give her family the very best in all possible areas of life but finds herself comparing the behind the scenes of her family's life with the highlight's reel of the lives of others. We have a little brother who, apart from loving dinosaurs, is afraid to express his feelings of any kind to anyone in fear of rejection and misunderstanding, not even being able to tell his sister how agonizingly much he will miss her once she leaves home. And we have a dumb and useless but absolutely lovable pug who is the soul of the whole film. All these character traits are very subtly and gradually exposed in the movie, while keeping the crazy, video-game-like, colorful mask to keep the youngest members of the audience entertained. Every character is relatable, you can see the quirks and behavior of each one in your own family members and I really admire how well they were able to frame these kinds of problems and stories that practically any family in the world has.This film is the definition of a family film, you are supposed to sit down and enjoy it with your whole family, although you must be careful - at least one is bound to cry by the end of it. Available on Netfilx.

reviews.review_title: Robocalyse Now: The Mitchells vs. the Machines
reviews.content: What we all need is some good, old-fashioned escapist fare! Right?!? What could be better than a nice, family-friend animated movie? How about an animated action-comedy about the robot apocalypse - Robocalypse? Enter Netflix with The Mitchells vs. The Machines. Is this just watch the therapist ordered? Here goes...The Mitchells vs. The Machines is an animated action-comedy about a typical middle-American family that embarks on a road trip to take the oldest child, Katie Mitchell, to film school in California. As it so happens, the robot apocalypse arrives in the middle of their trip. Here, Katie Mitchell is an aspiring filmmaker, always behind her camera and struggling to find her community through her artistic expression. Rick Mitchell, the father, doesn't understand Katie or anything about technology, really. The brewing tension between father and daughter bubbles over as Katie desperately wants to escape home and find her place at film school. In a bid to recapture their old bond, Rick packs up the family and plans to drive Katie to school across country as last minute family outing. As most cross-country family adventures go, the Mitchells are suffering through disappointing roadside attractions and general claustrophobia until the machines come and force the family to work together to save the world. It all happens in the way only an animated movie can do.There's a lot to recommend in this movie. First, the visual style is amazing. There is a lot of kinetic energy to the animation. You won't know where to look and the detail is inspiring. It is clever how there seems to be a mixed-media quality to the animation. It could get overwhelming at times, but it is never boring. Moreover, all of the various visual styles complement the story. Second, the writing hit the marks you would want from an action-adventure-comedy animated movie. There are sight gags that reference technology and social media. Fred Armisen and Beck Bennett play dim-witted robots, who team up with the Mitchells, and they add to the humor. Olivia Colman give a great voice-performance as the A. I. villain, who set the robot apocalypse in motion. She has the wit and mischievousness that these animated villains need. While there are some apocalypse tropes that pop up throughout, there is a lot more that feels fresh that what could be cliched does not completely derail the good time.My biggest gripe about The Mitchells vs. The Machines is that it takes a long time to get to the "vs. The Machines" part of the movie. There is a lot of set up. Obviously, the goal of the set up is so that the audience invests in the success of the family, particularly the rekindling of the father-daughter relationship; but, I felt that it took too long. Further, once the movie does get to the "vs. The Machines" part, while it is satisfying and entertaining, it also becomes too much of a good thing. At an hour and 49 minutes, the movie is too long and could have hit all of the action-comedy marks, including the emotional climax, if some extraneous things had been cut.Netflix certainly delivered with this one. The Mitchells vs. The Machines is a great family film that has nice themes about both individuality and family togetherness. There is humor and heart throughout. The action is entertaining and the animation is visually intriguing. Gather the family with a big box of popcorn and enjoy the Robocalypse.
Terrible everything. It's internet culture: the movie with "homages" to into the spiderverse thrown in.

The overall plot and message of the movie didn't do much for me but the action was interesting, it was written and animated pretty well but most of all it was really funny in a way both kids and adults can enjoy.

The movie is a great fun and a great family movie , you need to be with kids under 7 to explain some stuff .Adults will get the humour more but still very funny , a fresh new modern story , highly recommended .

reviews.review_title: Surprisingly fun with a nicely done story.
reviews.content: When I watched the trailer for this I wasn't really impressed. (I've now 100% stopped watching trailers) I'm really glad I gave it a watch though because it's a lot better than you might think.The characters are all great. Each family member, including the adorable robots, gets a lot of fun stuff to do, and none of them felt annoying. Sometimes in this kind of movie the 'misunderstood teen' character or the 'stuck in his ways father' can be really irritating and over the top, but here they felt a lot less stereotypical.The writing and humour was also great. There were enough references and jokes for the younger audience, but it wasn't too alienating for other ages either, as there was plenty of lines from the perspective of the older characters. I found that I was genuinely laughing at almost every joke, with a few huge standouts. (Everything involving the pug!)The story and message itself also pleasantly surprised me. Often the 'modern society' or 'technology bad' leans way too hard on one side of the argument and it can be painfully unsubtle, especially in kids films that feel the need to spell things out too much. In this movie though, we see both sides fairly and reasonably make their point, and it feels like the film is able to show positives about different perspectives, which is refreshing.Lastly, the animation is absolutely stunning. Beautiful colours and energetic action scenes that keep your eyes very happy.Overall this was great fun, with enjoyable characters and a lot of sweet and emotional moments too. It was much better than the trailers, and I'd give it a 9/10!

reviews.review_title: Big tech is telling me to not trust big tech...
reviews.content: I'm not sure what light in which to see this movie. It does a great job at pointing out we are enslaved by our own technology much like the second incredibles movie. However at every turn it tries to use the jokes from that technology to carry the humerous end of the movie. I dont follow internet fads so it went past me.I admit to identifying with the father. When he smashes all their phones it was cathartic. I often look around my living room when we have guests and everyone is on their phone. I wonder why waste the gas to come over if you are going to stare at a phone most of the time. I so want to instal a jammer to shut all the damn things down.So I am giving this a 6. It says things other movies have said but not as well.

The Mitchells vs. The Machines is a delightful adventure that manages to feel fresh and emotionally satisfying, even while adhering to a relatively formulaic but otherwise well executed three act narrative. The Mitchells vs. The Machines marks the latest great achievement by Sony Animation.

But alas being a family friendly movie, all is sorted while fighting for the survival of the world.It's super fun to watch and I hope there is a sequel to follow.VERDICT:
Highly recommended family viewing. Though parental guidance for the really young ones (ie. Under 7 years old).

reviews.review_title: One of the best films of the year
reviews.content: The Mitchells vs the Machines completely took me by surprise I went into it not expecting much and by the end of the film I was crying my eyes out. A film about a dysfunctional family going on a road trip doesn't sound all the unique but this film also includes robots taking over the world, its almost like a mix between the Incredibles and the Terminator and man its amazing. I absolutely loved the quirky and vibrant animation style it was really refreshing to see something so different from what a usual animated film looks like. The family storyline hit me right in the feels, I loved the relationship between Katie and her dad, and it was extremely satisfying seeing them reconnect again throughout the film. The film is hilarious I laughed out loud so many times and there where only a few jokes that didn't land for me. The picture perfect neighbours voiced by Chrissy Teagan and John Legend where easily among the best part of the film for me and I loved the two robots who befriend the family as well. The voice cast is terrific, Abbi Jacobson does a great job at voicing teenager Katie but Danny McBride was the stand out of me he gave such a believable and hilarious performance as dad Rick and I hope he does more similar roles in the future. The villain voiced brilliantly by Olivia Colman is on the forgettable side and feels like a very typical villain character but I did understand her motivations and she was quite funny and entertaining at times. The third act goes on a bit to long for my liking but I still really enjoyed it and it was wonderful seeing the family work together to take down the Robots. As much as I laughed watching this film I was also crying several times throughout it, the home videos of Katie and her Dad where tear jerking moments and the ending where Katie goes off to film school and the family share a beautiful goodbye left me with tears streaming down my face. I honestly think this is a film the whole family can enjoy, there is something here for everyone and the Mitchells vs the Machines is without a doubt one of the best films of the year so far.

America's dwindling attention spans are not lost on our esteemed creative industry. As social media and the omnipresent smartphone chip away at what little grey matter we've retained over the last decade, Hollywood is catering to our predicament by making films that are faster, uber saturated, and yes, dumber. They're in your face and out the door before you have time to greet them, and the Mitchells vs. The Machines is made in this frenetic mold, despite a plea to put down the tech and look each other in the eye. It's a film that doesn't live up to its own message.The film follows a family of four (plus a pug) as they save the world from a robot apocalypse, brought about by a dime store Jeff Bezos and a scorn A. I. smartphone. Splitting time plot-wise is the story of the family themselves, anchored by daughter Katie and patriarch Rick; she's leaving the nest and he's anxious about her burgeoning adulthood.As a kid-friendly actioner, the film is brisk and lively, with bursts of color and kinetic action. As a family drama it's repetitive and tedious at times, indulging in the grief of losing a kid to the big wide world. The voice cast is capable and grounded, if unspectacular, though they're purposely overshadowed by the pace and excessive quirk of the film, which is set to ludicrous speed from the word go.One of the most grating and repetitive elements is the idea of the Mitchells being a dysfunctional, hopelessly flawed family. This idea would spark emotional investment if there were any noticeable flaws in our main family, but there simply aren't; all four are generally hard working, tenacious, can-do, enormously kind, and almost entirely understanding.The film's emotional core is fixated on the almost while downplaying the Mitchell's positive traits, which are ample. The message of embracing flaws rings rather hollow when one of the flaws most repeatedly mentioned is...a young boy liking dinosaurs? The disconnect between the theme and execution is sometimes baffling.Overall, The Mitchells vs. The Machines is an above-average kids' film, which many adults will be able to invest themselves in. It doesn't live up to Kung Fu Panda's wonderfully choreographed action and lush cinematography or its Toy Story 3 theme, but it's an original and thematically relevant outing. Despite its hypocrisy and please-please-please-like-me quirkiness, it's a good time at home with the kids.

reviews.review_title: The Absolute Perfect, Splendid Piece of Heartfelt Comedy!
reviews.content: Lord and Miller REALLY have the formula down.This film is like the Croods and Emoji Movie combined. Except better in every way of course. This film not only LOOKS AMAZING, it is also so much more HILARIOUS than I expected, the story is straightforward and sticks to it really well.In film, it's incredibly hard to make heartfelt and comedic work equally well and have neither ruin the other. Both aspects in this movie compliment each other spectacularly.I saw the trailer and was afraid because a lot of what I took in could've gone SO wrong. I then looked up who the people behind the movie and my expectations went higher.Despite there being cliché relationship tropes, each character is just so well voiced and charismatic. They are all done excellently. I can relate a lot to relationship issues and seeing them fixed just fills my heart with joy.The thing that I love about this film is that it takes so many clichés and uses them to their absolute best. Proving that good movies can still be made even if there are more modern jokes and popular characteristics.Overall a movie that exceeded my expectations VERY highly. The perfect, splendid blend of Heartfelt and Comedy. I recommend this film to all and give as much love and support to you genius, hard working folks behind this film! I would be more surprised than ever if a better animated movie is released this year.10/10.

reviews.review_title: This movie is so amazingly chaotic and I love every second of it.
reviews.content: This is a wholesome movie about a weird, barely functional, family that take on the task of saving the world. It made me laugh so much I almost choke on my Nutella toast, and cry every time they had a heartfelt family scene.The animation in this is amazing, it's very different from other animated films I've seen so far in my life. Sometimes things and their texture feel out of place, which I'm guessing was done to keep with the "don't fit in"/weird feeling of the family. The soundtrack also goes hard and wraps up the whole vibe of the movie along with the little inside animations/sketches of the film.Sincerely, just watch this movie. Don't expect anything other than being amazed by it and multiple laughs.

reviews.review_title: Mindless fun, but not anything more.
reviews.content: This movie definitely has its fun and funny moments, but where it falls short for me is it's attempt to try and deliver a life lesson while simultaneously being completely out of the realm of possibility. It tries to show how a dysfunctional family comes together through hardship and in the end, finally understand one another. The dysfunction is comically on the nose and there is no subtlety to what they are trying to portray. If you're an adult, this probably won't resonate with you because of how blatantly obvious the themes are. If you are a child, this sets a completely unrealistic expectation for how the world works. Family dynamics aren't this blatantly obvious and easy to fix, and you're never going to go on some life altering adventure with the people in your life. The characters talk about how it's important to take chances and not play it safe, but they fail to mention that they have indestructible plot armor. There are countless times that these characters should have died, but made it out without a scratch. Life isn't just one comically happy ending where everything works out fine. More often than not, life is brutal. I understand that this is a cartoon and not meant to be taken seriously, but that's not how kids operate. Kids absorb this and as a result develop a delusional idea of how the world is a good place where nothing bad will happen. There are absolutely no consequences for the actions the characters take in this movie.So if you're looking for some mindless cartoon entertainment for the night, sure, give this a go, but please don't try to take anything meaningful away from this and I'd advise against showing this to kids.

reviews.review_title: Probably Will Be The Best Animated Film Of The Year

It has a wonderful script, wonderfully directed and watching it put a huge smile on my face.The Bad- I can't watch it for the first time again😂😂😂, I actually can't think of any big issues with this film it is awesome in every way.Overall I'm going to give The Mitchell's Vs The Machines a 9/10. It is a must watch.

Lovely family movie with some laugh out moments. Excellent cast and the script is superb. It's take on modern life is spot on and made me laugh out loud quite a few times. My kids who are aged 5 and 7 loved it as well as my wife and I. Don't miss it, one of the best family films we have seen for sometime.

I feel like this is the first animated movie I can genuinely say was made by millennials/genx towards the "zoomer" (or smartphone) generation and you can definitely see the effects both mostly good and sometimes bad.For me in the GenX generation, the action sequences were truly amazing but often hard to comprehend with comic books scribbles everywhere, giant colorful complex paintings randomly shoved in your face, robots flying all over the screen, and so many screams, internet memes and loud noises it was sometimes sensory overload. In a way I didn't like how the movie was 11/10 intensity the entire time. I felt tired during the one hour mark and decided to take a break to make popcorn and then I had fun again.The visual style of The Mitchell's & The Machines was entertaining though and the kind of fresh experimentation that Hollywood is sorely missing.I empathized with the daughter character, she was so passionate about going to Film School, while I never did go myself, I dreamed of doing it and her feelings were very close to mine at that age, really well written character. While this family is considered "dysfunctional" I thought they could have been a lot worse of people, they at least were always there for each other. The mother was hilarious! So overall I liked the characters.Our villains were pretty solid, they provided a good challenge and were a fun parody of current tech industry trends. Interestingly, the message of the film here was similar to Joker's "stop treating each other like disposable trash".Why I have given a 8/10, there were two plot holes, the father was unbelievably computer illiterate, also the art college looked really bad, nothing like Los Angeles and more like Boston that's just a nitpick.That said, I still recommend The Mitchells vs. The Machines! Watch it!

reviews.review_title: Great movie for the whole family!
reviews.content: This movie is very funny and heart warming! I would recommend for kids and/ or adults. I don't have any kids yet, and I enjoyed the movie from start to finish.

reviews.review_title: Best animated film of 2021? I certainly believe so!
reviews.content: I first heard of this title the day it was released. There was so much praise for it from many different animators and celebrities I follow on Twitter. When I finally watched it, I definitely saw why. This film comes from the minds behind some of my favorite things, including Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, The Lego Movie, and Gravity Falls! The animation is definitely top-notch, and I love how it blends CGI with live-action stock footage and photos, puppetry, and hand-drawn animation! I also really love the concept of putting a dysfunctional family against a robot apocalypse. The only thing I could do without was the casting of Chrissy Teigen as the snooty perfect next-door neighbor. She can't really voice act her way through a paper bag. So, Ms. Teigen, don't quit your day job. (Wait, what even IS your day job other than being Mrs. John Legend?) Anyhoo, I feel sorry for the other animated films coming out this year. They have a tough act to follow.

reviews.review_title: Definitely worth a watch...but I'm a bit disappointed.
reviews.content:
Firstly, I just want to say this movie is gorgeous and stylistic up the wazoo, not a shock for the writing team that helped craft this story. And I do think that it's an overall strong movie with a strong enough cast
, and a fantastically written script with a lot of wit and charm that it feels like an overall productive movie.But...man, the pandemic must've done some work to this movie because the pacing and especially the editing feels all over the place. It feels like some scenes move at breakneck paces while others are too slow, the villain never really seems to be bothered (minus one comedic scene) by the events, and their counter response to the family's actions is written off as a joke, essentially. Plus it feels like the dad and the daughter quite literally go through the same discussion four times in this movie. Does that make sense thematically, sure, but it makes for a movie that feels like it doesn't exactly know what hoop it's shooting for. And there are way, WAY too many jokes with the dog.I think it's a fun enough watch, but I don't think I'll really be playing this over and over again like some other recent animated films.

As a 30+ adult with 2 littles, this was the perfect movie night. It was HILARIOUS, sweet, heartwarming, and told an amazing family friendly story. It had everything we needed for laughs on a Friday night. Will watch it again and again!
Even though it does not matter to the story, it is so amazing that the main character is a lesbian. The world is slowly on the right track.

I only watched about 1 hour...I couldn't go further.This generational sickness now reached animations. Say goodbye to rich plots, great characters and interesting issues in Family Animation movies, specifically weird/dysfunctional Families, so well represented by The Incredibles , The Addams Family, even The Croods (extending to tv shows, we have The Simpsons, Family Guy, American Dad, etc)Since the Woke mentality has taken over all segments of entertainment, it's about time to infect Animations.Unlike the above mentioned movies, the "weirdness" of the Mitchells family is so artificial, so forced, so weak...it's there just to justify the endless (and shallow) messages of "careness" for themselves...begging the audience for some emotional connection, but we never get any.They leave from a slapstick/nosense/unfunny situation just to enter into another, even more slapstick/nosense/unfunny situation...and that pretty much summarizes the entire plot.I'm not saying it's a terrible movie...it's just a convoluted (and noisy) emptiness..

Obviously, it won't be interesting for adult audience: it is predictable, not innovative, not logical, has nothing new to say, and the whole smartphone-apocalypse to the main topic of the movie is more like a fifth foot to a dog.Still I had laughed couple of times.I think the combination of 2D and 3D animation were good. Also, good colors.Was watching when my girlfriend was sad. By the end of the movie her cheeks were wet, but she was smiling.
Trying too hard to be "relatable" and corky. The only funny characters are mom and robots. :)

reviews.review_title: This movie earn a space in my heart after Lilo & Stitch, Wall-e, and Up, Alita's Battle Angel, Big Hero 6

In end when it said it was based on true story then I got it because the movie had a unique vision, humor and heart which is missing from many films. This movie is for you. Today, when i kinda sad, i've watch this film. Woww, it's sooo..... artistic, emotional, soo...... well, y really should watch it and figure it out for yourself ^^

Unlike other reviewers, I did not find it hyperkinetic and over-the-top. It reminded me a lot of the Incredibles, since it was about a cartoon family pulling together to fight adversity. One "mature" reviewer said s/he thought being older biased them against the flashiness. However, I am older and really enjoyed it. Check it out!

I really enjoyed The Mitchells it's one of my favorite of 2021 followed by Luca (those 2 for sure will compete for best animated movie next year at the Oscars if nothing better comes along of course) but I enjoyed The Mitchells more, even know it's not a new concept but it's more connected to our reality for me. That sense of family they put in it is really heartwarming and makes you look at yourself and do better to connect with your family and pass over this inter-generational gate by realizing they sacrificed everything to exactly give you better opportunities than they had growing up without even a second thought(I literally have goosebumps writing those words) so they helped in the creation of that distance without even knowing it and will suffer from our unconsciousness that they did their best and still doing the best for us in our only best interest not even theirs so it's a beautiful love later to family, a warning to how much we let AI take control of our life and all of that put in a really funny way kinda not taking anything serious vibe all along. Really worth your time great storyline and screenplay!! Not only recommended for experienced spectators( that was the all point if the original storyline I think) but also great for an inexperienced audience....

I really enjoyed The Mitchells it's one of my favorite of 2021 followed by Luca (those 2 for sure will compete for best animated movie next year at the Oscars if nothing better comes along of course) but I enjoyed The Mitchells more, even know it's not a new concept but it's more connected to our reality for me. I thought this movie was gonna be weird and no one was gonna like it. Boy was I wrong. I loved this movie and its for all ages! This movie really deserves a ten out of ten because it was funny but sometimes serious as well. Also it made fun of furbies!! I loved this movie and highly recommend it to all.

This is one of those films that takes itself not seriously enough. The info dump hyper extra comedy, written in all caps intro is really not my thing. Felt like a poorly made Youtube video. But I ubderstand that it's designed for children.On a positive note, the animation is amazing. But I absolutly hate the over the top crazy ms paint thing. Although this was hilarious at points. But I'm afraid that I have run out of positives.The plot is so predictable its painful. I knew how the film was going to end before the first quarter. I hate those ironic comments judt before something bad happens. There are so many stupid things, such as a robot arm having a control panel.

reviews.review_title: That's how an animated movie should be made.
reviews.content: Meet every expectations one can have from an animated movie. Full of creativity and ideas. Waiting for a long for movie like this. The characters, punchlines, imaginations. Just wow. Loved the movie. 10/10.

reviews.review_title: A great family film, filled with all different tropes and antics
reviews.content: When I first watched this movie, I was already enthralled. I enjoyed seeing how each family member has their own antics and quirks, Rick being the "I wanna live outdoors" kinda guy, Linda being the supportive role model and mama bear, Katie working towards being a film producer and Aaron being a big Dino nerd. I loved all the different tropes and references in the movie (will robots turn evil, are phones bad, robot apocalypse, Furbies) I think this movie has potential for a sequel or a tv spin-off series.
Urgh.. "technology taking over the world", loud and not funny. Only good thing was the animation itself. Another generic, loud, "social media" packed movie. Couldn't finish it.

A family movie that every family needs to see it! I love this movie and i got shocked when pal (the phone villain) mentioned taylor swift omg and there's so many adventures and it's fun to watch! 8/10! For this wonderful movie with great animation!

reviews.review_title: Got me in tears in 13 min. - Heartwarming and Funny
reviews.content: I love this. First off the story is great!The animation mash of styles is amazing, just like 'Into The Spider-Verse'. This is a wholesome family movie for young and old. I cried multiple times from the sincere moments.Sony Animation is stepping up their game and Pixar Animation has some competition!

Good entertainment. Especially when you're feeling down. This movie is all about positivity and about how good intentions do not always come across as such.Go see this with the whole family and enjoy the show!

I was kind of expecting the worst. I am an older guy seeking my childhood through animated movies. I enjoyed every minute of this and I regret nothing. I still don't know who did voices, but everything about it was great! I would love to see more! Thank you for making this such a good watch!!
Recommend it to everyone to watch with their families😊

Wow, superb animation film,a blaze of colour and daftness that can get away with it. Some parts go waaaay far out which rolled my eyes but like Speed Racer it's drugs for the eyes and keeps senses entertained , funny in parts and very very enjoyable, hope they make more like this .

reviews.review_title: ONE OF THE BEST SONY ANIMATED FEATURE FILMS OF ALL-TIME
reviews.content: This is such a masterpiece film and I was very happy that this got nominated for the Oscars in 2022. When this movie wins the Oscars, I'm going to scream! It tells a great funny story with gorgeous animation, likable characters, epic final battles, funny moments and the ending is very sweet!Fantastic movie (100)
Goood . Goood .goood .goods .1 time watch. Watch it for fun.

reviews.review_title: Just watch it ya sweaty meat bag
reviews.content: You will laugh, you will cry, you will want to clean your phone & you will definitely want to go adopt a pug .... what more could you ask for in a movie???

reviews.review_title: Tron (1982) reloaded: There's an AI living in your smartphone!
reviews.content: This idea will shock some people: The internet is not inside of your phone. Without a worldwide, energy hungry infrastructure it's not so smart after all. The big bad in "The Mitchells ..." is a really big brained AI living in a normal smartphone. It controls a gigantic army of humanoid flying robots with futuristic weapons in their arms. Why? Because those robots looks great and most people can relate to a smartphone. That's why.They don't even care to use some lazy explaination like: It's a smartphone from a parallel universe, where it did build all those robots, vehicles and buildings it uses to capture and subjugate 7 billion people. This is a movie from the metaverse, where everything that looks vaguely familiar, because similar things had been shown on some screen before, will be accepted.It's not only the basic premise of "The Mitchells ..." that's insane. This is just another product of a brainless industry with great technicians and machines that produces shiny, colorful, fast moving entertainement for people who can shut down their brain while watching this.Just one other of the many things wrong with "The Mitchells ...": The daughter uses the family dog to make trashy Youtube videos, like quite a few 12 year old boys do. She shows a short, cruel, edgy clip in her class and the boys just look completely shocked. What are they? Some kind of freaks? This scene is supposed to demonstrate how much of an outsider she is. Her brother is a freak, because he is into dinosaurs, the (of course very, very goofy) father, because he is into nature. This would be very ordinary "freaks", if they were not so completely obsessed with the one thing that defines them. They are very one-dimensional characters, shrill, boring and charmless caricatures.Tron (1982) was an electric fairy tale about people living in a computer, silly, but imaginative, groundbreaking and with an unique charme."The Mitchells ..." is a silly tale about an AI person living in a smartphone, an irrelevant rehash of better movies, probably partially compiled by some stupid AI, but thanks to the vast number of ideas thrown at the audience it is still mildly entertaining.

What a fun film. The humor was clever and I even busted out laughing many times. The only thing I would do is cut it by five minutes near the end as it really gets too frantic. Otherwise this has to be up for the Best Animated Feature if there is an Academy Awards next year!

reviews.review_title: Like most over the top live action movies but family friendly...
reviews.content: Reviewers who say this is over the top or ridiculous obviously have never watched an action movie, & near the end, when the dad is melting down trying to learn how to use the computer, it's reminiscent for those of us who lived in the 90's when computers came to regular non-computer-whiz people's homes. Just a silly, fun, family movie especially for those of us who come from adhd families!!! Cuteness overload!

reviews.review_title: It's a fun movie. And yes, weird.
reviews.content: I enjoy it, it's fun and have a message. It can be watched by anyone, thou the effects and some stuff bother me and is predictable. It's a typical family movie that have a plot, message and lesson. Nothin new for me the way the story goes but overall me and my brother enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Great fun and some original characters
reviews.content: Loved it eventho it's a little over the top. The humor was great tho and the film is just very easy to watch.Better than a lot of similar ones. Not the best, but certainly up there with the better ones.

The movie writing in and of itself is not bad. Not necessarily original, but it's a kids movie so I won't begrudge them that. What felt wrong was the pacing. An 1:53 movie is probably too long for a kids movie. I watched this with my kids, and had to stop early because it ran so long. We were well into what felt like the third act and climax, and I stopped to see how much was left, and there was still more than a quarter of the movie left to go when it should have been maybe 10% max. Probably because the midpoint came way too early.

reviews.review_title: Nice... except for the sly ending
reviews.content: I'm not going to throw the baby out with the bath water. This was a cute movie with a nice ending. But I am tired of Hollywood always throwing in little LGBT agenda driven moments into kids movies. The rest was good.

I initially dismissed this movie, and even after watching the trailer, I wasn't compelled to watch it, but once I started the film I not only enjoyed it, I wound up loving it. I even cried. Maybe it's just me, but I definitely found it relatable.

Violent, preachy and the animation was sub-par at best. It tried hard to be another Wall-E but, well, it wasn't even close. The writing is stunted and seems to be saying that violence is ok as long as you're doling it out from behind a plupit or atop a soap box. Obviously made by people with more money than talent.

reviews.review_title: it was 9/10 until the last 10 seconds
reviews.content: Well amazing movie and i literally put 9/10 at 5 minutes to the end. It was perfect until some idiot at ten seconds to the end has decided to sexualize the girl and obviously..if there is a strong smart and funny girl...guess guess ... ENOUGH!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: You having a bad day? Do you miss your family? Watch this movie right now.
reviews.content: It's literally a family movie! Are you having a bad day? Just open it up and watch and cheer up. This movie , which contains at least one piece of everyone's family, is definitely a masterpiece. The relationships and events in the film are wonderfully reflected. Definitely watch.

reviews.review_title: Surely a blissful watch, Comedy and other emotions
reviews.content: This is one of the funniest animated movies I have seen in years. This movie blew me away. Not just with it's comedy, which it totally nails, but with its heart as well.It's surely relatable to the current generation and one preceding too; focusing on tech and YouTube and what kids are doing. Having a varied interests like making short films for YouTube, interested in dinosaur universe.Animated movies have a basic motive; making films which can be watched with your family, this one is truly the best one. Mitchells Family may not be the perfect family, where there are differences between parents and offspring; but we see how they overcome their differences and connect.Even if it has the most generic storyline, you are emerged into all the emotions of each and every character, because they are so well established from the very beginning.Surely a blissful watch.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful movie that is not talked about enough
reviews.content: I'd never even heard of this film so went into it with pretty low expectations and was blown away. The family dynamic is believable and I really enjoyed the animation style. It talked about some pretty serious themes and was really heartfelt and emotional. The voice actors were all very good and fitted the characters perfectly. I also want to point out that this is how you write a LGBTQIA+ character. The main character's sexuality was never shoved into the spot light for no reason and it felt so nice for a gay character to simply exist instead of struggling with their sexuality. Funny, heartfelt and memorable. I wish I'd watched this movie a lot sooner.

I am writing this review with my thoughts still fresh, as I only finished the movie ten minutes ago.I haven't written reviews in a shockingly long time, but this movie of all movies, surprisingly was the one that inspired me to start writing again.Now, time for the review.The animationThis movie's animation is stellar. It's gorgeous. I can see Sony played with some of the ideas from Into The Spiderverse, but this animation plays a surprisingly significant roll in the film. The main character, Katie, is one quirky teenager, and the animation really fits in with her personality, which is nice because the movie is narrated by her.Animation: 9/10 - freaking gorgeous.The storyThe story isn't really unique, as I'm sure we've all seen the "rebellious/misunderstood teen and the very bad at communication/I have never used a computer before type of dad, but it handles these themes really well. The story was kind of slow, bumpy and uneven near the start, but at the end I applauded for as long as I could. The payoff is amazing, though it might just a tiny bit have stretched on for too long.The story: 7/10 - pretty darn good, also quite emotional I may add.The humorThe humor. I will not say anymore about it. It's so good it bumped this review up by one star. Just go watch it for a good time.Humor: 10/10 - missed a few times but DAMN it's funny.Character developmentI love the characters. They have their own personality, but aren't entirely two dimensional and each have their own moment. I loved to see the interaction between Katie and her father, and I absolutely love it when the emotional parts hit.Character development: 8/10 - fleshed out charactersBefore I go, I want to say, this movie does so well tying up loose ends and emotional parts. Without spoiling, parts at the beginning show up near the end as well, and it is a very nice surprise.Overall, an amazing family movie, movie or anything really. It basically gets everything right.9/10.

reviews.review_title: Awesome and hilarious movie to watch with your family!
reviews.content: The plot is great! Also, Its very well animated and I like the art style. The jokes are kinda funny too.
Everyone should watch this movie , a great one , with a massive message and meaning . This movie shows the importance of family and how machines are harmful.

Fantastic movie. Very much enjoyed it. Was also incredibly pleased to see that the main character was gay, and treated so normally for it. First children's movie I've seen with a main character that's gay. Great way to do lgbt rep.

The animation down to all the intricate details was beautiful to watch. After Klaus and the Spiderverse, I hope this movie paves the way for stylized 3D animation.It was sad to see how hard they tried to be funny. The story was as unoriginal as it gets.
I couldn't take my eyes off the screen.. Very funny movie.. Didn't expected that.. It was way beyond my expectations 😂👏

reviews.review_title: Its ok to be part of a weird family.
reviews.content: Full of fun conedy.It does brings joy & laughter watching this family journey.The dog is the definitely Man of the match of this movie.
Its not funny or charming but it makes you watch it.

Very enjoyable. I'm probably not the first to point out that the finger-wagging at Big Tech is a bit rich in the context of a feature-length CGI film, but ok, fine, maybe we're over-analyzing it. There are quite a few very satisfying moments in the script, nice animation, and good voice work. There's some sharply observed stuff about families, although I must say that animated features getting all angsty about familial relationships is not exactly fresh or innovative at this point, and "Iron Giant" and "The Incredibles" and "Coco" and all did it better. But it was fun, and well worth watching.By the way, is it, like, illegal or something to make a movie without Olivia Colman in it? Don't get me wrong, I think she's a magnificently talented actor; I've been a fan since all the way back to "Peep Show." Good for her for making it to the top, but it's becoming kind of amusing that she seems to be in EVERYTHING these days.

This movie is so bad. We stopped watching it. My children said they were not enjoying it, I found the content inappropriate for young children and can't believe it is a U rating. The storyline is boring and the animation is not great.

reviews.review_title: A fun film from start to finish
reviews.content: It is a fantastically well created cheesey family fun film, from start to finish the animation style in full affect and extremely well suited to this film, yes its predictable but its still fun on how it all works.

6/10. Good for the family and for a laugh. Don't go looking for a good plotline.The plot is very basic and doesn't make sense at time, but this movie is good for a laugh. Everyone in the family can enjoy this movie. It is by no means a masterpiece, and the animation style leaves a lot to be desired. The extra "quirks" of the modern internet don't add very much to the movie. Mark is one of the best characters in the movie. I completely disagree with the voice actor for Katie's brother. Although an interesting character, it is ruined by the VA.

I must say i was very impressed with this movie, when i saw the trailer, i had little hope for this movie, thought it would be another Illumination level garbage.Then i was told the director of this movie was the same as Spiderverse, ( also, both movies were made by sony ) you know, the best movie of past decade?! The movie that pushed the boundaries of 3d?So i was only sure of one thing, even if the story was garbage, even if the pacing dragged the whole thing off, I was sure the visuals would rock, and it didLet's talk about visuals, i'm going to be brief here, the visual style blew me away, it's nothing like i've seen before, it's on-par with Spiderverse.Let's talk the story for a moment, remember when everyone said the premise of the movie was conflicted?Going for a family trip story, plug off your phones, spend time with your family, reject technology or something along the lines.But then everyone was surprised by the robots invasion, technology going against us! It turned into an action movie, with a kinda apocalyptic theme.Now.. let's ask the question: can these two themes coexist, and create a compelling story? Yes it can!The story jusy needs to go for their family story beats, and also the action story beats.But the highlight of the story would be the characters, the characters were an interesting bit, they had some interesting dynamics, with the most developed being the father and daughter, which were kinda tied with the family vs technology theme , which was their source of conflict.The movie started because of their conflict, the daughter, representing the tech side, with an obsession for film, got accepted on film school and was soon going to move out.The father, representing the family side was not happy with that, so he decided to go onto the last family trip togetherA nice little touch was the other 2 characters, mom and the little brothers being the bridge to their characters' resolution.I really liked the characters, and the change they've been gone through, a big plus for me.At the end of the day, the movies visuals were groundbreaking, and the story was good. With its message not being "reject technology" or "live in the woods" but its more like "technology and family can coexist, and they can even help each other"
Fun times ahead with the Mitchell's.Adult and kid humour with a great message.. You don't have to be a perfect family to be perfect as a family.

My younger siblings enjoyed it but for me it was just a generic kid friendly comedy trying so so so hard to be different it was cringey. I appreciate the LGBTQ+ representation but the whole thing was hard to watch tbh. Glad my brother enjoyed it though.
Its a very good movie . Feeling fresh while watching the movie .its fun ,good and it also teaches about the family values like how our family member are important to ours.

reviews.review_title: You will laugh the WHOLE way through the movie.
reviews.content: This movie has so much heart yet funny as heck. Fantastic movie for whole family. Both parents and kids can relate to the material which in turn has you laughing your butt off. Really well done. I would purchase this movie. Will be recommending to friends and family. A+ "Two thumbs way up!"

reviews.review_title: Longer than it needs to be
reviews.content: At 1:13 I thought "40 minutes left? It's not over yet?" At this point it seemed it should only have 15 minutes left. I watched with my granddaughter who even struggled to keep interested. A lot going on yet still too slow and stereotypical teenage girl angst. Other than the two defective robots and sometimes the mom most the characters aren't likable.

reviews.review_title: Either you love or you meh it
reviews.content: Loved the movie, the style, the humor, the real moments, but seeing the reviews off those who didn't like it I can understand their arguments. I think this is a movie that you either love it or you feel it was nothing special, depending on your life situation and humor.To me the movies characters were fun and surprisingly relatable with dept.And the animation, wow. Just wow.
A great movie about family I loved the dictation of relationship between the teenager and her dad.The animation was incredible and it was funny to watch.
