I forgoted this is an animation movie. Fully enjoyable movie starts to end.

reviews.review_title: Wonderfully written and animated. A delightful movie.
reviews.content: This movie hit every angle.The animation was creative and a non stop spectacle. The voice acting was realistic and wide ranged. The story was well written and had a great balance of comedy (hilarious), action, drama and sci-fi.A heartwarming, family friendly movie that that teaches some valuable perspectives.Worth watching more than once 😊
Good mix of nice visuals, good story, humour (especially slapstick)Would recommend as a family film.

This movie is hilarious and is one of the few movies that's given me a legit laugh, I don't understand all the negative feedback for this movie, because this is just a silly, "dumb" and well made movie
I laughed almost non stop from start to finish and highly recommended to any age, its shows the struggle in family, the struggle for parents to connect with their kids in the ever evolving technological world we live in
Sure, it may have some clichés here and there, but that's the point.I really recommend watching the movie and then come with your own opinions on this and not get affected by the reviews.

reviews.review_title: No exaggeration from the reviews, this movie is phenomenal in every way & hit me right in the heart
reviews.content: I need to go off, this movie was something else. Ignore me if you want.I loved every single thing about this movie. When I first saw this in my Netflix feed, I thought nothing of it. I never heard about the movie before I saw it. No news of it and I never even saw any reviews of it. I immediately thought it was something like Wonderpark or the Emoji Movie or Ugly Dolls. I immediately passed it off until someone on here praised it. I looked it up on IMDB and RT and it had great reviews. I just finished and after writing this, I am immediately gonna rewatch it.I connected with this movie. It parallels my life so much right now. Katie, a film loving teenage girl who struggles to connect with her dad is excited to go to University soon to be with people who are exactly like her. She has a little brother who is hilarious and a mum who is embarrassing yet caring and loving. Not to mention the dumb dog.Change her to male and we're the same character, thats basically my life right now. I have a hilarious little brother who is a great friend. A dumb dog who I love to bits. Two caring parents who sometimes, I struggle to connect with. A character who is going to university to study their passion. I'm off to Uni in September. Not to study film but it almost was what I was taking actually. I just connected with this so much and there were moments where I got teary eyes.This movie is hilarious. Every joke lands and none of them feel forced. They feel organic and they fit the overall tone and aesthetic of the movie. The gags in the background fit the movie so well and I always had a smile on my face watching it.The animation, dear god the animation was gorgeous. Its battling with a Silent Voice right now for best looking animation right now and I think it might win. The lighting, the settings, the character design, everything about how it looked was incredible.Another thing about the jokes is that I think it really handled Internet jokes and Gen Z jokes so so so well. In movies like Ralph Breaks the Internet or the Emoji Movie failed to this because they focused on using the Internet and memes as the concept of the story and it feels forced. With this movie, it felt organic and funny because it wasn't the focus. The focus was on the family which was right.The story is fun, the robots were great, the villain was fun, not to be taken seriously but a good villain I think.I am giving this movie a A+, 10/10, 5 Stars, whatever. I loved this movie to pieces.
Filled with a quirky and comedic plot, along with hilarious jokes and moments, The Mitchells VS The Machines is definitely a must-watch for the family! You'll LOVE it!

I don't know how you could possibly not give this film 10 stars. It's one of the best family movies we've seen in a long time. All three of our boys were laughing so hard, they laughed in ways I've never heard before. We even had to pause a few times because my husband and I couldn't stop laughing and no one could hear the movie. What a great cast! Maya and Danny of course are A+. We loved all the pop culture references and still have Rihanna stuck in our head. This is a great movie for the family, promise you. You'll laugh, you'll cry. And then you'll watch it everyday, every hour for the next two weeks because your kids are obsessed!

Loved the entier film and ... God it was so humorous. I expected it to be good but it came out to be better ... God sony is making real progress with animation ... Hope for a sequel as soon as possible. Also the quality is tremendously great and I live thier way of presentation of shots.Expected a lousy and emotional type ending btw father and daughter .... but it went well executed and came out to be one of the best I ever saw.Entire film is a RELIEF and u gonna love that dog so much ... Also all the characters got their part of development in the first few minutes which really got them more CONNECTED to us.I would DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS ... ITS WORTH UR WATCH.

Good voice acting and excellent animation. The script is packed with so many jokes that we plan to rewatch the film, because we missed some of the gags when we were laughing. We are two middle-aged adults and found it laugh-out-loud funny.

reviews.review_title: This is how good I expected Soul to be!
reviews.content: Excellent film. Creative but beautiful animation and ingenious and relevant concept. Fun and great family watch. Will be watching many times!

Good one. Entertaining,doesn't get bored while watching. Has some good jokes and action scenes. Animation is wonderful. Some movies can be watched multiple times and still doesn't get bored. But this one i think is a one time watch.
My Daughter's and I loved it, they laughed and that's a win at the moment.

reviews.review_title: Its better than you'd ever expect
reviews.content: I didn't know what I was getting into when I saw those trailers. A gorgeous-looking film from a great company, but the plot seemed REDICULOUS. And you know what? It still is, and you'll probably love it.There's so many laughs, there's a lot of heart, and you'll fall in love with every member of the Mitchells, right down to their wacky little pug. Try not to take the film too seriously, its a family movie through it all, and you'll have the best time ever if you just go in blind and with no expectations.

Unbelievable that this robot apocalyptic movie that involves the potential end of the human race, human capture, giant scary furbys and appliances, and fighting is rated U! This should at least be a PG!

reviews.review_title: Awesome animation with a great story
reviews.content: There were a lot of genuinely funny moments and they really leaned into meme culture which just added a great dynamic to the movie even if a lot of the jokes could probably be considered "meta". The animation style is super unique and fits the movie extremely well, it's worth the watch just for that. The score is amazing and the little details and references are crazy. You can watch this movie multiple times and not find them all. There were of course the obligatory couple of really wholesome moments to round out the movie. There were also some pretty cliche parts, for example the father daughter dynamic was taken right out of the family movie handbook but didn't take away too much from the overall feel for me.

reviews.review_title: Probably one of the worst animated films I have ever seen
reviews.content: I had very high hopes from the movie but it was disappointing to say the least. The experimental antiques were too over the top and very distracting. The characters were very run of the mill and one dimensional. And I am not sure why they show pug as mentally challenged. All in all, never recommending it to anyone ever.

reviews.review_title: One of the best animated movies in 2021
reviews.content: In a year when movies were postponed a lot they really kept this one for theatres. But they decided to release this and i was really surprised by the visuals the work they put on this. It's magnificent visuals and magnetic story will keep you hooked. Recommended to watch this please give it a try.

reviews.review_title: "The Mitchells vs. The Machines" - Using Art to Save the World Maria Elena Gutierrez"The Mitchells vs. The Machines" - Using Art to Save the World by Maria Elena Gutierrez
reviews.content:
The Mitchells vs. The Machines sends a dysfunctional family on a road trip across the United States, then almost immediately plunges them into a cataclysmic robot uprising. Bursting with comedic energy, the film plays with mixed media and a sketchy animation style, artfully subverting expectations about what an animated feature should look like.Expectations are further upended by the storyline. In the current round of mainstream Hollywood movies, we are bombarded by stories about "perfect" superheroes. Such films present their creators with a difficult challenge: how to make their superpowered characters relatable to an audience of ordinary people who will never in their lives be able to leap over tall buildings or fly faster than a bullet.With The Mitchells vs. The Machines, however, writer-directors Mike Rianda and Jeff Rowe have channelled a different kind of superpower: their own understanding that, in the real world, misfits are far more commonplace than superheroes. Celebrating "weirdos," Rianda and Rowe have chosen as their protagonists a group of ordinary people. The heroism of Katie Mitchell and her quirky family lies in the everyday dimension. It is their very imperfection that makes them relatable, and we as an audience find their flaws endearing because ultimately we all feel that we ourselves are flawed.Of course, the very goofiness of the Mitchell family also provides an endless source of entertainment - rightly so, since this is, after all, a family comedy. The filmmakers exploit the humor of bathos and hyperbole, permitting their characters to note with dry comic timing that, while some families are grappling with organising their family photo albums, or dealing with picky eaters, the Mitchells have to manage a robot apocalypse. Pop culture references abound, from youth-friendly commentary on the politics of social media, to evocations of classic movies that are sure to please the more mature crowd -
In Pal's geometric core there are echo's of Stanley Kubrick's monolith from from 2001: A Space Odyssey.Hidden beneath this sense of fun is a simple but profound message of reassurance: that it is okay to be odd. This idea is supported by the circular nature of the Mitchell family's strange odyssey, which begins with the suggestion that their weirdness is something that sets them apart. At the end of the film, however, as we listen to young Katie Mitchell's speech about why humanity should be saved, we see how this family of misfits has transformed itself into something special and magical. This shows us that the magic exist in our every day lives. We just have to look at it through the right lens. "Weirdness," it seems,
is what makes us unique.Turning our attention to the Mitchells' neighbours - an image-obsessed superhero family call the Poseys - we might even detect echoes of an everyday cultural struggle in which working class people live in passive envy of their apparently perfect upper class counterparts. Social media addicts derive pleasure from both watching and being watched, and so the relationship between 'weird' mother Linda Mitchell and her 'perfect' counterpart Hailey Posey can be read as a model of mimetic desire. The relationship endures to the end - when Hailey finally demonstrates her new-found acceptance of Linda by allowing the Mitchell mother to follow her on Instagram, the irony of this gracious gesture is all too apparent.This particular dynamic delivers its own share of entertainment to an audience that knows what it is to be the underdog. Watching the film, we experience a certain sado-masochistic pleasure not only in seeing the Mitchells triumph over their adversaries, but also in sharing the various torments they endure themselves.Yet The Mitchells vs. The Machines also presents us with another juxtaposition: that of a natural world built on love and human values, in contrast to the technological realm of Silicon Valley and social media, where people are caught up in endless images of themselves, not who they really are.In their own different ways, therefore, the individual members of the Mitchell family are battling not only to defeat the robots, but also to find their true selves. One such route to self-discovery lies in the space of memory - presented in vibrant form throughout the film. By immersing ourselves in the past, we discover a state of being that is more genuine than the cultural state in which we find ourselves today, and within which we can ultimately achieve enlightenment.The Pater familias (father of the family), Rick Mitchell, seeks such knowledge through his love of nature. A modern-day Luddite, he advises his movie-obsessed daughter, Katie, to look at the world not through her camera lens but with her own eyes, which he describes as 'nature's camera.' And so Rick's world view aligns closely with the film's assertion that technology in the wrong hands can be lethal. At the same time, it portrays the tension between father and daughter. Fearful as he is, Rick wants only to protect Katie - part of his journey is learning that the best way to do this is to let her go.Through all this, it is Katie's philosophy that ultimately prevails. From her position at the heart of the story, this young girl instantly presents herself as a storyteller, as she attempts to escape reality through the medium of cinema. Katie's youthful enthusiasm for zany imagery and crazy ideas is mirrored in the dynamic visual style of The Mitchells vs The Machines. Is she in fact the alter ego of the film's directors? It is hard to argue against the idea.Katie's agency in the story is further reinforced by her status as an openly gay character. With seemingly effortless ease, The Mitchells vs The Machines succeeds in broadcasting and celebrating her sexuality - often through simple visual devices such as the rainbow button she wears - while at the same time never drawing undue attention to it. It is rare for the LGBQT community to be represented so naturally in a Hollywood film - especially an animated feature - and this subtle balancing act is to be applauded.As the robots threaten to overwhelm the planet, it is Katie's passion for art - and her father's eventual recognition of arts value - that saves the day. From the beginning, the film demonstrates that Katie's way of knowing herself and understanding reality is through her art - which she perceives as an expression of her weirdness. And so, it is Katie who teaches us the lesson that lies at the heart of The Mitchells vs The Machines: that art will not only save us in the end, but it will heal us, too.Dr. Maria Elena Gutierrez is the CEO and executive director of VIEW Conference, Italy's premiere annual digital media conference. VIEW Conference is committed to bringing a diversity of voices to the forefront in animation, visual effects and games.

The movie is in the future with robots and the guy who built the robots ditches a software which made him famous called 'pal'. Bowman who built robots gets captured by the robots because pal hacks them. The robots go all over the city capture the people and locks them. And the Mitchell's are the only one who are not locked and they're not a family with coordination but they somehow defeat pal and save the whole world. The story could've been better, the songs for the movie are overall.

reviews.review_title: Until the climax began, the movie was ok, but then, I started enjoying the movie a lot more.
reviews.content: This movie shows why the climax of a movie is so important. Until the climax began, I was actually a bit underwhelmed by the movie. I even yawned here and there. It is a good movie, it has a strong emotional core, but the action scenes did not engage me much. But once the climax began, it is brilliant. The movie went to the next level. It made me enjoy the silliness. It gave me the freedom to feel silly, and not feel bad about it. Because of the very entertaining climax I give this movie a 9/10.
The visuals are good, has some good comedy, but i find any scene that includes solely the mitchells extremely boring or bad. The robots were 90% of the comedy in the movie.

reviews.review_title: Creative and fun but a bit on the nose...
reviews.content: First of all, I am an adult... I do not have a family. I am not the target audience for this movie.That being said, I was going in with hopes that it would be close to as good as Into the Spiderverse (maybe a ridiculous assumption as that was one of the best films the year it came out). It was definitely not that.The robots/blow-y up-y bits were really fun. But the whole family tension thing... not for me. And it's not that I don't appreciate that stuff done well, it was like it was every other scene... so much of the movie was devoted to the family drama aspect that the overall plot and the stakes of it felt a bit hollow. There are ways to do both effectively, like The Incredibles. But this just came off as preachy, overly wordy, and very direct.But overall it was a fine movie, the animation was great, it was actually really witty with some kinda wild adult humor at times (cthulhu furby? Yes, please!). Just wish it was a bit less on the nose with it's family message and let the whole plot breathe more.
What a wonderful movie for the whole family to enjoy.
Great movie, jokes are right on the spot!CGI is top notch and voice acting is awesome.Can't wait for more.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the best animated movie of the year!
reviews.content: It balances fun, emotion, jokes, and everything you would want in animated kids movies, better than most out there. I have to see if this one gets best animated feature!

reviews.review_title: Light family comedy to watch on that tiring end of the day.
reviews.content:
I am not an expert in analyzing animations, but I will try.I had heard about this film only at the end of last year, although it aroused my curiosity and I didn't have many expectations, I think that's why I really liked the film.Before I start I want to comment with sony animations has been doing better projects since the generic Emojis film. The positive points of this work are several, ranging from technical quality to characters. Technically speaking it is beautiful, the film has a comedy tone and a very youthful and cool animation style that works, a montage that favors comedy and drama, although it has some jokes that didn't work very well with me, and the drama part it works very well, knowing when to take it seriously or not, when the film becomes a self-parody yields very good jokes,
Although I don't think I am the right person to analyze the voice works since I can only differentiate if it is very bad or very good, so I will not be able to go as deep as I would like. That said, I liked the characters more, all of that family I can relate to in some way, Katie's love of cinema, Aaron's passion for dinosaurs, Rick's affection for nature, Linda's unconditional love for her children and the extreme cuteness of Pug Monchi. The villain is a very cool thing in this, first: she is voiced by Olivia Colman, second: she has a valid motivation, abandonment, which is something that is very explored in the film within the Mitchell family.Only two things bothered me about the film, the '' violence '' and some plotters. I left the word violence in quotes because the situations that the family goes through would be impossible not to get hurt in any way, and since the rating is G, the filmmakers could not put very strong scenes.Although the script is good, sometimes there is the feeling that something in the middle doesn't make much narrative sense, like the shopping scene, the villain could have sent her entire army of robots to pick up the family, but she preferred appliances to going after them, even though she has the underestimated could send a little better warpower. There are still other script inconsistencies that I would like to comment on but then I would have to enter the spoilers zone.In resume: The Mitchells vs. The Machines is a light family comedy to watch on that tiring end of the day and maybe get a little emotional.Note: 7,7 / 10,0.

Timely and visually stunning. Deals with modern "first world" problems in a lighthearted and entertaining way. Sony animation has hit another home run after Spider Man Into the Spiderverse. I think they hold the crown from Pixar now it terms of clever heartwarming and funny family entertainment.

This movie manages to mash up cutsie humor that my 5 year old laughs at and surprisingly dark humor for my wife and I. They refreshed the whole AI wants to get rid of humans plot in a hilarious and well thought out way. It is definitely worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: It's made by the spider verse team and it shows
reviews.content: It's a great film in every aspect of the sense, you can feel the passion behind it and the lively animation. Watch it if you haven't already.

reviews.review_title: One of the best in recent years
reviews.content: Totally worth! I would go to cinema to see it again if they would play it in my city :)

reviews.review_title: "Technology Zeitgeist and Why Everyone Eats Looking At Their Phone"
reviews.content: Awful movie. It felt like it was written by a disconected bommer oldman who tried to capture the "essence of the youth" after discovering reddit and 9gag. Or maybe some bunch of millenial tried to explore this "weird relationship between boomers and genZ".The story is cringe, cliche, slow and bad written in general. Like a very bad Adam Sandler movie, but unironically. After seeing so many 10 stars rating here, I'm seriously considering leaving IMBd. Are people really setting their bar so low? There are bots in IMDb? Damn, I like bad movies, but wouldn't give them the BEST rating just because they are fun.

This is one of the best animated films I've seen in years. Sony pictures animation is legit in Disney/Pixar you better look out! This is one of the funniest animated films I have ever seen. My wife and I kept having to rear wind it and watch scenes again they were so funny. The humor here should be universal because it's not basic humor it's like humor from a seasoned pro comedian Who just has a gift and everyone laughs. The comedy has perfect timing and placement speed everything. This movie is a well-willed machine of laughs and truly lets you empathize with the characters and what they represent and is certainly relatable and overarm major arching themes. As you get close to the characters it's a little bit of an emotional roller coaster and is completely within the purview of real life which may be is what makes it so touching and why it resonates with me and our ideas of family. This movie just hits the spot and every way possible the sound and animation are impeccable and they CGI combined with the drawn on screen type graphic, works amazingly well. As does their stop and start timing of sound and music and resignation and fruition of small comedic and emotional seeds that bloom into bigger ideas. This is creative art done perfectly well that it just makes you laugh out loud and empathize and relate with the characters if they send multiple good messages. I cannot give this phone high enough praise. In terms of recent film which has been lacking a little bit of depth like this does and I'm not just talking about plot death I'm talking more about the subtext of the plot even if it is simple. This is a joy ride where the hits just keep on coming and coming. What I mean about the complexity is this film is that the combination of elements required to make such a great film at so many levels is what makes it so fantastic. Not that it has a deeply complex plot or anything like that but that the sound the animation the writing the direction the production the timing the concept the art department everything just comes together perfectly and Sony fires on all cylinders and absolutely nails this film and something that I completely did not expect. This movie hit me hard and unexpectedly and was absolutely awesome and deserves all the credit.

I actually created an account just to finally write a review. I've loved lots of movies out there but this movie really hit home for me. I laughed so hard with my kids; despite tons of quirky YouTube/meme references that I typically don't enjoy, the movie uses them as a vehicle to share what my kids are growing up with. I grew up watching Son in law with Pauly Shore, and it just resonated with the scene when the Dad finally crosses over and learns what his son is into. Maybe it's just tugging at nostalgia strings, but I really loved this movie.

reviews.review_title: A Good Laugh and I Teared Up A Bit
reviews.content: This movie is absolutly fantastic in terms of comedic timing and animation stylization. It is the first movie to do jokes with modern technology that did not do a SINGLE joke that made me cringe, all of them felt natural - except that one with the primate meme, that was the only one that felt forced, but all the other jokes really came together naturally. The awkward moments are funny but if that's not your kind of humour there are still many funny gags that don't rely on awkwardness.The movie has a generic family plot, but it works just fine and it doesn't need to be innovative for it to be a fun watch. It's all very good.There is a minor reveal at the end about Katie's character that really should have been built up better throughout the movie, we barely get hints about it and most of the people watching it will completly forget this aspect of her character - which sucks since it could have put her on a place where many people watching would perhaps see a bit of themselves in her since it's a marginalized group. The climax drags a little bit too and two characters could have been handled differently during it - but I reveal too much about the characters I'll end up getting into spoiler territory and I do not wish to do that. I also wish some of the jokes during the road trip plot could have been more abrupt because it would only amplify their impact - but hey, this criticism might as well be nitpicky at this point.Anyways, please go watch this movie, stop comparing it to Spiderverse and have your fun.
The best animated movie i ever watched.It is so fresh and packed with action, fun, and touched my inner emotions. Super cool animation methods used.
Broadly speaking this film reminds me of Ironman 2, but how this film is shot from the point of view of a family that seems "normal" makes me feel that this film is very exciting.
The story was too much predictable. And it was so cheesy that I could watch it with wine and crackers. But some jokes were on point (not all of them).

reviews.review_title: Sadly this goes over some peoples heads
reviews.content: but if you're vaguely updated on the pop cultures of the last 30 years and appreciate quick-witted humor, this movie is for you.Underneath a snappy and modern exterior hides both fantastic caricatures of people that are easily read and endeering. It also encapsulates the life of a teenager and her dad, beautifully captured from both sides. It is easy for a teen to sympathize with the dad, and vice versa.I laughed constantly through this and can't wait to watch it with my future children. Of course then I first have to show them a thorough list of all the references to fully enjoy it... but that's a project for another time!

Once coming across the trailer I knew I had to watch this. Kooky, fun and just pure comedy genius. I just did not want this to end. I want more. Animation was spot on using mix mediums. Can't wait to re watch.
Amazing story, so funny.... Loved it!I watched it with kids, they loved it but the humor works so well for adults too.The cinematography is excellent as well.
This movie has some good animation. The story line is great and overall well made.

A brilliant, fun movie that manages to elicit the full gamut of emotions. Artificial Intelligence taking over the world is a predictable plotline played out by many movies, but this is delivered perfectly with loveable characters, great acting and a refreshing new animation style.

This movie, is a universal acclaim and worldwide phenomenon. People around the world love it because of it groundbreaking animation and favorite characters. The reason why I love it is that because Victor Carlos, the character designer of Corn & Peg worked on the film as an animator.

reviews.review_title: Packed with obvious phrases and s**t
reviews.content: Don't come here... This movie has just it's fluid animation going for it. Plotvise it's just not delivering anything surprising, instead it's awfully politically correct through and through. If you want to see a somewhat techcritic family-movie, check out Nextgen instead.
There are some realistic approach despite being a kids show but this movie has a mixture with mainly 3D elements and an occasionally 2D elements, hopefully there are more movie work like this.

This is a feel-good look at family in the 21st century. It's about love, finding common ground, and family.It also is has evil fighting robots - something for everyone.The characters are incredibly charming, the animation is beautiful, and the story is touching. A great film for everyone to enjoy.
Went in with low expectations but was blown away! Fantastic storyline and animation! This is now a must watch!

Modern, funny, wide ranging in its appeal and topical. Visually stunning (as was into the Spiderverse before it) and brilliantly paced. 2 hour films that keep the whole family (a 4 year old boy and a 9 year old daughter) interested until the end. Hugely impressive.
Amazing job sony ,funny +Family +super exciting.This is what we called a Family movie.

At 35 years old, I grew up during the animated Disney renaissance and I have to say this is one of the best animated movies I've ever seen! I can't even count how many times I bursted into laughter out loud. I feel like most modern animated films stunt cast with names who don't match their characters - not this film. Brilliant casting! Last but not least, a unique and fresh animation style. Everything looked detailed yet still "loose" in a painterly style. What an achievement this charming, hilarious film is!
Finally a movie that is not, we have a problem, journey, solved.I snorted a lot. Watch it with your kids.
Watched this today with my eight year old son and we both laughed continuously. Worth the watch! Great kids movie.

reviews.review_title: If I had watched sooner, I will cheer for this to get an Oscar.
reviews.content: Full of energy and heartwarming that I don't get for a long time. The theme of the story is not that different from the later Disney/Pixar films, but with its own unique storytelling, the rhythm of the storyline, and fabulous creativity. Made it full of euphoria and really filled my heart with joy and tears.Each character has its own color that represents a distinctive personality that can related to a lot of people. As they travel to save the world, they also have save their relationship with each other. Even though it may seem repetitive like Disney movies, it's something. But something about it makes it perfectly different and modern without any compromising.Lastly is style The folks who did this also did Into the Spider-Verse too, which didn't surprise me. That this story will have a laugh-out-loud beauty in every frame. I really want to see this in theaters, it's going to be awesome.

Have been disappointed with a lot of animated family movies lately but this was a pleasant surprise. Loved the different style of animation, the story, lots of genuinely funny parts. The usual lessons for the viewers but done so well. All round just great and highly recommended. Didn't hurt that my family of 4 is very similar to the Mitchells although I'm definitely a better dad lol.

Forget all the mean comments, this movie is for anyone! It's a masterpiece! Soundtrack, character design, animation (other level), history, character development, everything is so damn good! I LOVE THIS MOVIE! THANK YOU NETFLIX AND SONY FOR MAKING THIS! I will never forget!

This movie encompasses what life is like nowadays for teens AND parents. Maybe to the extremes, but it does. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie along with my ten year old son. It sends a good message for everyone involved.
Sat down to watch this movie, namely to humour my son, and BOOM I was hooked. Non stop action, comedy and some great animation.Highly reccomended.

This story couldn't come at a better time, when people and families are faced with the challenges of covid isolation. It's witty and creative with a new take on cartoon animation. The large number of SNL cast added to the fun. Everything was on point. Great family fun!

A pretty mediocre experience despite of all the hype it received. The family drama is honestly the best part and could have been great if it stuck to that, but the rest of the movie involving the robot uprising was predictable and kind of stupid. The humor is definitely the worst thing though, since most of the jokes involve internet humor or meta one liners about how stupid something is that completely breaks the immersion it was setting. Also, the supposed lesbian representation was barely in it, as there are really no hints to go off through out the movie about the relationship between Katie and Jade and the only definitive thing we get is that Katie mentions at the end of the film that she would bring her home.The animation was nicely stylized throughout, which I found to be quite enjoyable, but it's such a shame such a great and cool looking animation aesthetic was wasted on such a mediocre script.
Loved this movie! It is funny and shows what a family is all about. Also love the fact that Netflix offers a great Spanish translation.
Cross between Incredibles, Tron, Scott Pilgrim this thing definitely has something for everyone! It has its moments of eye rolling but overall, I really enjoyed it.

Sony's 1st Comeback is Spider Man Into The Spider Verse, but for Sony's 2nd Comeback is The Mitchells vs. The Machines. I love this movie I saw it with my Dad, and did a GREAT JOB like they also did a GREAT JOB for Spiderman Into The Spider Verse. It is a WONDERFUL MASTERPIECE 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Stupid premise, some fun gags, fun asian quiz show style animation.
reviews.content: There are 8 billion humans on this planet. Most of them do not own a smart phone. Most of them are not active on social media. And they are spread over an area of.150000000 square.kilometers. So the abject stupidity of the premise gets in the way of the enjoyment of the creative animation. Sorry for being such a reality-based person but engineering constraints? Military response? I try to imagine robots not immune to blunt force trauma collecting Taliban fighters in the mountains of Afghanistan, and fail. 'It's just a story' doesn't cut it. Just TOO STUPID.

reviews.review_title: Adorable family movie, emphasis on the family
reviews.content: I wasn't expecting to love this movie going into it, but surprise, it's very cute, creative, and extremely heartwarming.It's very hyperactive with a lot of internet pop culture bursting throughout. It was a bit much for me, but it adds to the flavor of the film and I think would resonate more with a demographic younger than me.With however much is going on screen, the script is pretty tight. By focusing on the father daughter relationship and having every major theme connect to that somehow, the film comes across very streamlined. You really understand their relationship, and how they struggle to connect but nonetheless want to do something. We're given enough background to them and their emotions to feel their tensions and become invested. Balancing this family story with a wacky premise worked very well, and you can tell that the people who made this really loved what they were making.There's also a lot of genuinely funny moments that I laughed out loud at. Not every bit of humor works, but enough of it catered to my tastes.I would highly recommend this as a feel good family movie night, or for anyone just looking to have a good time and doesn't mind a bit of stereotypical weirdness.

This is one of the funniest movies I've seen in the past couple years. It obviously appeals more to a younger demographic due to a lot of the humor, but I seriously could not keep a straight face while watching it. And the animation style is perfect for the movie's comedic tone. It also has some emotional moments that work. But while the exposition is great, setting up the emotional beats throughout the plot, the actual story could be more fleshed out. And the movie is also a little longer than necessary, I feel. There are also some missed opportunities for jokes, but other than that, this is just a really fun and hilarious family movie that certainly deserves a watch.

For animation fanatics, this is similar to The Incredibles but taken place during modern times where smartphones and the internet exist. Honestly this movie has SO MUCH heart than people give it credit for. Especially with the Mitchells being a strong asset to the overall film. Each family member is distinct and likeable enough to the point of wanting them to succeed so bad! Sure for every 1 or 2 misfires in jokes (specifically the internet meme jokes), there's so much of them that gave me a good laugh. I enjoyed it so much to the point of rewatching it 3 times on Netflix and it I like it even more upon rewatch.
This film is Rreally funny, creative and uplifting. It's also got some really touching moments about familiy members learning to understand each other.
The creators of into the spiderverse do it again!Funny film with some absurd bizarre comedy and incredible animation.

reviews.review_title: Tears from laughter and heartfelt moments
reviews.content: This was surprising a movie that I'll call one of the best animated films I've ever seen. Top 10 easily. While being very far fetched, it was also some of the best portrayals of a real family. Moments of weakness and moments of strength. Laughter, tears, dysfunction at its finest. That dog, pig, dog, pig, loaf of bread bit. Gold!

I find it amusing when adults rate kids movies so harshly. To even rate this movie below a 7 is criminal. It has beautiful unique animation, fun and quirky humor and great voice acting. But the most important thing is that my 5 year old loves it, you know who the movie is made for.When a children's movie can entertain both kid and parent, that's a huge win, and for a Netflix release The Mitchell's vs. The Machines accomplishes just that.

It was great, it was a little loud but then we turned out TV volume down, it was super relatable to my own family experiences, I appreciate an accurate portrayal of the robot apocalypse, having a pug is the key to surviving, the pug is the life ring, power of the pug, inspiring movie to watch with the family to remind them why you should do intense survival training,
Dog cop needs to be a show, more movies about munchie in general need to be made.

reviews.review_title: Love It So Much It Features Colors Comedy And Sci-fi
reviews.content: This Is The Most Entertaining Film I Ever Watched On Netflix I Sees Some Real Family Pictures And I Love The Dialogue Also I Believe Sony Is Not Even Sponsored By Anything In This Film Like Furby Instagram Or YouTube I'm Not Doing Spoilers About It Okay And Also This Review Is Going To Michael Rianda And Jeff Rowe Thank You For Reading This.

reviews.review_title: A phenomenal story about how far a family will go for eachother
reviews.content: An absolutely heartwarming movie with fun punts and also showing the love between a father and daughter and how far love can go. I can't express how great this movie was in all aspects.
This movie didn't do a thing for me. I watched it because my son asked me to.The only thing I really found funny was the dog.
See title. Don't understand all the bad reviews. Everyone's a critic. EVEN ME! I give it a 10!

It's quite clearly this movie has been given proper care script, character and development wise and not just another animation money grab from a big studio but that should be expected as it was produced by Phil lord and Christ miller the visionaries behind into the spiderverse. Overall a great animation ,possibly the highlight animation of 2021 and did I mention the soundtrack is absolutely amazing??
This is called mater creativity. Who would've thought a robot invasion will foster family bond.
This movie hit the spot with cheezy jokes. Everyone is expecting new and fun jokes but sleezy ones like these + combining old world with modern one took a special place in my heart.A definite watch.

reviews.review_title: Best Animated Family Film Since The Lego Movie
reviews.content: I saw the trailer and thought it would be a fun family movie, but I didn't expect to love it this much! Seriously, you have to watch it, at least to finally figure out if Monchi is a dog, or...pig, or a loaf of bread?

I haven't seen such a style of animation in any movie. Movie gives a great message through its plot. It is a must movie to watch with all of your family. Director has given a strong message through the movie.You will enjoy the family in movie and may correlate with yours.

A company creating robotic intelligence to rule the world and dominate humans (the chip is everywhere in everything - guess what happen when you switch off the WIFI ?). It's a dream a nightmare, reality ? An average family with funny noses that live in remote, with funny noses, will save the situation. Let me guess. Yes it's a crazy movie. Entertaining with these colorful animation and the story of the dog cop. Family movie, promoting hope, love, dreams.

We have a 4 year old that never sits in movies, and he watched the whole thing. I never cry in movies, and I teared up twice in this movie. This movie speaks to parents, kids, families in general. 10/10. +1 for bringing machine learning to the storyline - touche.

While the animation is excellent, the story does not shine that brightly. The comedic aspect of the movie is enjoyable and well balanced with the emotional sub plot (that hit way too close to home for me and had me crying like a baby). However, many plot points seem forced and the logic is behind some characters' actions is non existent. My expectations in the story arc were low from the beginning, but certain parts of it seemed so nonsensical to me that I could not fully enjoy it anymore. Since the overall tone is rather goofy, this does not matter as much as it would with a different kind of movie.Overall it was worth watching, but I would not watch it a second time.

This movie has a lot going for it, lots of action, excitement, character development and more. The family was likeable and believable, the plot was interesting, but the journey and chemistry was the best part of the movie. I've watched this a few times now and wouldn't mind watching it again. Eric and Deborahbot 5000 have a cult following, they were hilarious to follow through the movie. It's great for kids and adults. Some of the weird videos could've been left out, but what movie doesn't have flaws.
Parents, teens, small kids, and everyone will surely be tearing up crying & also be rolling on the floor laughing. Wow amazing!

I was recommended this film and I'm glad I watched it. The main family are clearly all a mix of neurodivergent people (autism, adhd). And it was fun to see that portrayed in a cartoon. The storyline was a little obvious in places but it made me laugh and I would definitely watch again. A must see.
Highly entertaining. Had me laughing the whole time. Attention to detail and humour. Not the most original plot, but it was good enough. Good family movie.

My word I don't know where to begin with this movie. Me and my adult housemates put it on for an easy watch but I had been anticipating this movie since the same studio that did Spiderman into the spiderverse created this film.The plot was fantastic, the jokes made me slap my knee and laugh incredibly hard multiple times even though it's a kids film.I think some of the reviewers who watch this film aren't aware it's literally for children. I honestly can't rave about this film enough. I've suggested it to all my friends with children as I expect this to be a classic of the next generation.Fantastic job overall and absolutely loved the references to the geo political issues with tech industries and treating LGBTQ+ Characters as human beings without needing to token these characters.10/10 studios could take some lessons from this film especially since the emoji movie came from Sony also. It gives Pixar and Disney a run for its money and reminds me of better days with films like cloudy with a chance of meatballs.

A fun family road-trip movie wrapped around a robot apocalypse. From relatable family perspectives to a bouncy soundtrack, this movie nearly had it all. Unfortunately, the directors felt the need to shoehorn in a completely unnecessary subplot that detracted more than it enhanced. Shame. :-(

To be honest after seeing the trailer i thought the story was kind of stupid why? I first felt it was about the dream of the main character of bieng a filmmaker but when I saw the machines I felt it's messed up but boy I was wrong, the film was fantastic it knows how to mix between emotion and comedy + with good music, well now your saying what further more but there's this diamond that makes the show the best 2021, well what is it? It's family the show showcases the sad and good relationship of the family in an apocalypse life and they presented it in the best way that can be the best ever made and still people say it's bad.
Really wish I could rate this higher than a 10. The most fun I've had with a movie in ages and delivers incredible emotion and action.

Can't say every seconds' literature of this film.. Just enjoy with your family or you will miss that feeling to love your dearer one. The plot is written on Robotic era's story which is quite true. But the most true thing of this movie is that FEELING.Laughed for comedy, Loved for animation.!!!!2021!!!!

reviews.review_title: It's a flawed movie, but its messages on human relationtionships haven't been more important
reviews.content:
The Mitchells vs The Machines has its flaws(the visual effects can get a bit annoying, there are some flaws in the script), but honestly, I think this is, above all else, an important movie, not just for kids, but for adults and teens in an age where human interactions and even emotional inteligence have diminished in many people. Like it or not, technology is a bit to blame on that, but thats besides the point.This is a movie with a purpose to be launched in 2021 and that's one of the biggest honors I can give to a piece of art.But enough with all this serious talk, this movie has other qualities. It's incredibly funny and looks really gorgeous. The camera angles were particularly good and the edition was greeeat. The characters are really well written and they're super expressive.(Small thing, but I personally recomend you watching this movie in English, if you can. I personally think movies ethos kinda gets lost in translation, but that's just me)
Seriously, don't sleep on this.
When I chose this movie to watch with my family, it had my curiosity.Now that I've watched. It has my attention.10.0/10.0.
Love this movie. A great family timepass movie that has all the thrills for the kids.Entertaining music + awesome graphics.

reviews.review_title: The perfect modern animated film doesn't exi-
reviews.content: While animated films seem to struggle finding their aesthetic or soul in 2021, The Michells vs. The Machines demonstrates that it is perfectly possible to be successful in talking to and about the new generation. It playfully delivers an intergenerational openness message, and wish actually very fun to watch. This is exactly what you would expect from a cartoon. New technologies are central to the play and the message is there: well used, they are the ally of a healthy personal and common development, which cultivates the inner child that lies dormant in us. This movie is perfect, thank you.

The Mitchells vs. The Machines has to be one of the better Netflix titles to come out in a long time. Innovative plot device that showcases the talented team of Lord and Miller. This is how they should be making original funny stories and it's refreshing to find another animated studio that can compete with Pixar. The films success lies with the characters and overall story arc that doesn't feel like its stuck in a typical cliche model. There's a rich universe here and it would've been nice for this film to open in all cinemas like it was previously intended. The style of the animation feels unique and not part of standard Pixar or Disney aesthetic. These filmmakers and writers have a giant future ahead of them and you'll not have wasted time if you watch this film.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Incredible Movie, & I went into it with extremely high expectations
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of both Gravity Falls and anything Phil Lord and Chris Miller are involved with. I'm also a huge fan of the majority of the voice cast. And I've been following this film since it was announced, quite a while ago. So I had what I thought were unrealistic expectations. I was blown away. The animation is incredible. I loved the characters. I found them relatable and very easy to connect with. The story was handled very well, and paced perfectly. There wasn't a dull moment. It was the funniest film, hands down, that I have seen in at least 2 years. I found myself missing jokes because there were sequences where they just didn't stop, and I was doubled over laughing hysterically. It's got a quirky spin, which I love. I just found it to be a really special film. I can't say enough good things about it.

Hold on to your screens, folks! The Mitchells vs. The Machines is a hilarious and heartwarming animated adventure that is sure to hit all the right buttons. The film is a clever commentary on our addiction to technology, brought to life by a well-animated cast of lovable misfits. Katie Mitchell, a young filmmaker, takes center stage as she embarks on a family road trip with her wilderness-loving father, Rick. But when a tech millionaire's obsession with innovation leads to a robot uprising, the Mitchells must band together to save the world from being taken over by machines.With top-notch animation and a talented voice cast, The Mitchells vs. The Machines is a visual feast that will have you laughing out loud. The rapid-fire jokes and puns are cleverly woven throughout the story, highlighting our reliance on technology while embracing the unique quirks of each member of the Mitchell family. The film's emotional depth enriches the story, making it more meaningful and engaging.But it's not just the humor and animation that make this film a standout. The Mitchells vs. The Machines also features LGBTQ+ representation, with Katie Mitchell being referenced as gay in a way that feels natural and authentic. The film strikes a balance between being topical and entertaining, making it a must-watch for families.Overall, The Mitchells vs. The Machines is a well-crafted animated comedy that delivers a message about the importance of real-life connection and communication. So, grab some popcorn and buckle up for a joyous and hilarious misadventure that is sure to leave you feeling uplifted and inspired.

The movie begins not bad, but with time it will be boring. They make jokes that are not funny, I laughed maybe once. I think its more for children. The Idear is not bad, but the implementation was not here. The Characters were individual wroten good, i liked the dog, the funny scenes was only with him. They try to do something new, but in my opinion it didn't work. It had to much picture speech bubbles and jokes for children. Its not a adult animation more for children until 5 years.
I enjoyed it but, the blatant marketing propaganda is annoying and shamefully directed at children.

Adorable movie! Funny, fun, sweet. I love that the family is "dysfunctional" but really just like your average family. The animations and sounds were great too. Good story line and in a way relatable to today's world. Love that it is LGBTQ supportive also. Am definitely surprised it is PG though, with words like scumbag and stabbing robots in the face and chest then getting covered in robot blood? Not really PG to me. But as an adult I loved it.

reviews.review_title: Laugh out loud by the whole family
reviews.content: This is a funny heart felt movie that will bring any family together. Me, my 7 and 13 yr old were laughing out loud!
Oh I've been waiting for this one for so long!!! It was amazingly funny and so relevant, while still delivering some important messages about family and love and what truly matters.

reviews.review_title: Boring movie and waste of time 🙄🙄
reviews.content: This movie is totally overrated and, not saying I AM a homophobe. Which I am not. Homophobes should not watch this because the main character is a lesbian or a girl that is attracted to other girls!!! She is very rude to her dad. Also the humor is NOT that funny. They used a screaming gibbon monkey and songs that already exist and aren't catchy. Another thing that is bad about this piece of garbage is the fact that Deborahbot's name is Deborah, which is a female name and I guess Sony didn't realize that. Oh yeah. They poorly designed the Pal Max Robots and how the heck could they could not tell if Monchi was a dog, a pig, or loaf of bread? Because he is overweight! That's why! And Monchi doesn't even look like a dog to begin with. How on earth did Eric and Deborahbot wake up if they are already crushed? That didn't work with other Pal Max Robots. What the heck? WATCH ENCANTO!!!! If you do NOT have Disney+ for any reason because you are too lazy to get it, too bad so sad. Encanto is WAY better than Mitchells vs machines because they do not use memes, they do not include songs that already exist, and the animation is WAY cooler and better.
Storyline and animation was good, plus it was funny. The kids enjoyed it but sometimes it felt as though there was some overdoing of the "funny" or "relatable" parts. Good watch though.

reviews.review_title: Best Animated Film of the year
reviews.content: All I can say is that movie was really great. It was funny, heartwarming, and action-packed.I watched a lot of movies this year and this one was my favorite. It hits a bullseye with its family dynamic which really highlighted the generation difference between parent and child.The story tells the story of a creative child who's parents don't really understand her passion for film-making, which is something I feel a lot of families encounter.The movie is a roller-coaster of emotions, but leaves you feeling very optimistic about life and just makes you want to go hug yo ur parent/child.

This animated movie is so awesome, I had to write something about it. This movie genuinely holds some of the best hilarious scenes and snippets I have seen in a very long long time. I laughed so much, and suddenly I realized I haven't laughed and felt such a joy from watching a movie in a while... Believe it or not, this movie is a pure joy elixir!As a family man, a father of both a boy and a girl, there were some scenes that even managed to move me, and made me think of them, and how much I love them and happy to have them in my life, and that I would really do anything to keep them safe. This movie is a must, you will not regret watching it!!!

This really deserves an oscar. I love the mixture of emotional and funny in the unpredictable storyline. It's fun, it's energetic and hilarious. The animators seemed to know what they were doing and you can pause frame by frame to understand that. The 2D and 3D combination was done gorgeously even anime struggles to do that. Im a fan of this movie now i love it and im sure anyone who loves these genres can be fan too. Recommended to everyone.
Good. I would watch it again.definitely in my top 10.
This is one of my favourite animated movies now. Funny as hell and it actually have a meaning, to take care of your family. Been a while since Ive seen a good animated movie like this. Well done.
Brilliant. I was in a bad mood and watching this made me feel better.

OMG OMG!!A perfect movie for gen z and there's so much representation in this it's perfect! This is what we mean by having BIPOC, LGBTQ+, and the neurodivergent community in one movie this is perfect! Great job.

When I saw the trailer for this back when it was still called "Connected" I thought that this was gonna be a commentary on how "Technology bad" but it was actually kinda the opposite. On top of that, it made me laugh so many times which is pretty good for a kids film (Saying how most of them are just toilet humor which isn't really my thing). In all it was a pretty good film but had some flaws like Aaron's voice actor sounding nothing like a kid or the villain not being very interesting, but it was a good watch.

reviews.review_title: For me, the best movie in 2021 so far👍🏻
reviews.content: ...didn't expected that, but hey what a great adventure. The Mitchells are superb from the first to the last minute. Great story and emotional moments. Please give us a part 2... Mitchells vs ??
It's so different to Disney and Pixar and those types of animated films. It's stunning!! Story is funny with real funny parts for adults and kids. It ticks all the boxes 👍👍.

reviews.review_title: Fun and adventurous animated film about family!
reviews.content: Really enjoyed this fun family film. Very cool animation and nice story and voice cast as well!

We all laughed. A lot. We were all glued to the tv the entire time and everyone walked away saying what a great movie it was and that we'd watch it againOf course it predictable. The family that isn't getting along have to fight an army of robots to save the world. Did you think they'd stay estranged and die fighting the robot hoards thereby dooming the human race? Now that would be a terrible movieIt's a good funny movie with a heart and a message. The entire family will love it.
Amazing film show's you how good are your family and let you know that you should love them because every family has good things and bad things so love it.

Did not expect this film to be so great.Really nice animation, very similar to Spiderman into the Spiderverse and a very good story, well written. A feel good film with great humor, watch it... even if you don't have kids!

reviews.review_title: This is not going to be an ordinary review
reviews.content: This is one of the best animation movies of the last decade. Here is why:The story is incredibly gripping; catchy dialogues; huge humor and touching drama; the great balance between those two genres that also often transitions into action; a very decent twist; innovative animation style; It refers to wide range type of audience; extremely well delivered messages; and lastly... Everything is super relatable.Its fast pace is one of a kind that really stands out among any other blockbuster animations out there and I actually liked it, but it's very easy to miss or not understand some of the fast cut scenes and dialogues. This was my only issue but all the other awesomeness brought out with this movie easily compensates the rest.When it comes to the 'reality police' and 'I-want-to-scream-so-hard' reviewers... Claiming that this is not realistic at all.. The movie actually presents one of the most realistic, relatable and anticipated future stories out there. There are hundreds of other animations that are loved mainly for the execution of the graphics, the fun and certain delivered emotions within a fantasy script that has sub par realistic notions in it. Why don't you go ahead and criticize those instead? You rather give them 9/10 because you were so captivated by the fantasy world your eyes laid on or for some other bullcrap personal reasons. Be real with yourself.Whoa! Out of billions of families in the world, only them, Mitchells get to be left out and get to fight to save the world. What are the chances?! Whatever the chances of witnessing a few number living animals that belong to nearly extinct breed located on earth (endlessly destructed by us humans) :) Everything is possible. Deal with it. And for the love of... whatever you love the most divine...Find better sources to seek realism. And remember this is only a movie. An animation movie. Medium for your soul hence entertainment and meditation or whatever you might want to call it. And nothing about humans nor their creations are perfect and can never be.A lot of the things in the film are Americanized, modernized and were made seem like saving the USA meant saving the world (just like many made-in-USA movies and shows. How surprising!). When all the people were released out of their pods they were held captive in; it looked more like as if it was just the number of people of one city in a state of NA rather than even being one state of people, or the entire NA country not to mention "the world".So what?Yes, some parts and details could have been thought off better, but so what? Why all the perfectionism over it? Why all the hilarious nitpicking? Just adapt; sympathize; take what's good; note down the baddies; put them on a scale; then zoom out and look at it again for the overall perspective... Then give your rating. You wouldn't give a movie like this less than 7 out of 10 even if it didn't impress you as much. It is pretty objective to say that those who rated it lower than that have apparent non-viable criticism ethics, because they did it for any other reason but to review it with true eyes, mind and soul.In my sincere opinion, people who disliked this movie or somehow wanted to make it seem like it; rated it low; and wrote harsh criticism about it have serious issues. I can't wrap my head around the idea of how someone can hate an animation movie that has full of blissful, exciting, emotional, eye-tearing of laughter and emotions, and "I've been there" moments that also has right on spot humanity and relationship lessons including human psyche rendition. I was shocked not seeing the rating 9 or above. Honestly, this is what's wrong with some people. They simply can't see or accept what actually good or bad is. They also can't empathize, neither can have proper functioning judgment.Don't ever bother reading those ridiculous reviews or get fooled by them. It is a must-to-watch movie.I applaud every single person in the pre-production, production and post-production teams of The Mitchells vs The Robots. Very well-done guys. Respect.

reviews.review_title: Could this be the perfect animated movie for the time?
reviews.content:
Honestly it might be better than perfect.The timing was far beyond anything that could be expected of a movie that came, seemingly, out of nowhere. So here's my breakdown:The Animation:
Unbelievably good styling. I don't think I've ever seen anyone combine the 3d styling of Illumination with cell shading that reminds me of a super high res TF2. Very fluid animation, very fun articulation of the character, absolutely beautiful scenery. The emoji style bursts really rounded out the visuals.The Story:
Fun beyond reason. Very well paced humor and every joke landed perfectly. Was the concept recycled? Sure. But lets be honest, what concept isn't?Overall Rating: If I could give this an 11/10 I would do so without question. I don't think I've ever seen a more soulful movie and I hope we see more from this studio.Not going to lie, I ended this movie with tears in my eyes because of how much I loved it.

reviews.review_title: Your whole family is going to laugh.
reviews.content: Yep. 80s, 90s references for the old folks and new jokes for the kids. Clean humor. Nice reflection on technology and family that everyone can relate too. Extremely funny. Very well done.
There was a lot of heart and a great story behind this movie. One of our favourite cartoons.
Oh myyy gush!!!!This was amazing ✨ we enjoyed it soo much! One of the most super funny animation i ever seen till now!!

I was really skeptical at the beginning, but what should I say?I have laughed and cried because it was a really beautiful funny movie.You can see how the world in the families it's turning to be with soviel media and internet. But at the end what it counts the most is love and the family. Really really nice.
I am not a kids film except from spider-verse and a few others. I recommend because it can make you laugh, cry and just have fun.

I created an account just to review this movie. I really loved the style of the animation and the special effects. Although, I did find the animation a little too flashy at times.I liked the family and they did remind me of my family. However, the voice actor for the little brother is really bad and does not even sound like a kid.Overall, I thought the plot was interesting but I feel like the pacing was off and that this was too long for an animated movie. I feel like this movie would have been better if it didn't have all of the robot/sci-fi stuff and just focused on the Mitchell family themselves and their relationship with technology. I would have liked this to just be a nice family comedy instead of a weird sci-fi movie that tries too hard to be funny.
This film should be rated more than 100 , it deserves to win a couple of oscars.

Maybe we talk about the next oscar animation winner film. Spectacular visuals, great story line, fresh ideas.. and emotional family issues we can all relate. The Mitchells vs the Machines is a funny, emotional, thrilling movie which you are not going to forget.
What a lovely family movie, as robots confront humans, the Mitch family seeks to save and save humanity.

I think this was a good approach to the topic of the fear of robots taking over the world. However, it is very messy. The storyline is clear and structured, but sometimes there are so many things happening at once that concentrating on one aspect only is nearly impossible. This movie has a great humorous side to it that children will definitely enjoy!"The Mitchells" in the title is deserved. After all, the movie is all about this family and their constellation. The creators did a great job showing various facettes of a family relationship. You truly feel for the characters.In the end, it is a fun movie to watch and the voice actors did a really good job in portraying the characters.
We laughed out loud the entire movie - it's hilarious and adorable. My kids didn't understand half the jokes (they're under 7 years old), but still had a blast. Awesome voice cast as well!

reviews.review_title: "This is the Best Animated Movies of 2021!"
reviews.content: This is the One of This Funny, Action-Pack Adventures, Robot Apocalypse, Road Trip, Comedy, Animated Movie and The Movie Does Feel Like 'The LEGO Movie,' 'Gravity Falls,' & 'Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse' and I Hope Sony Animation Pictures Win This Again!

This movie feels like the modern day equivalent of A Goofy Movie just replacing the 90s references with internet references and of course the robot uprising which I felt like a movie like that could have been made but not in the way I was expecting. This is genuinely a new favorite of mine. Sony Pictures Animation really have surprising these past couple years and I look forward to whatever comes next.

reviews.review_title: This might be the best animation I've seen in a while.
reviews.content: As someone said here, this really puts to shame a lot of the animations made in the past few years. It was so humorous. Some of the jokes might be a little cringe but hey it is an animation. It should be intended for kids not for us, adults, who cam differentiate between the jokes. The animation was on point. Music was on point. The idea was awesome and it really made me cry a little because I thought about my parents and our road trips, even if they trips wheren't as awesome as the Mitchells' one.Everyone should give this one a chance and remember the beautiful time they spent with their parents or if they were unfortunate, at least learn how to behave with their future kids or behave in general.

Good movie. I like the part where that one guy does that one thing; forgot his name. I also like that one part at that other place where that oher dude does that other thing for those other people. I forget the names10/10.
Great movie - No Spoilers ! Just watch and you'll see how cool it is :)

First of all, the art work was great! I could randomly pause the movie and find something to make me chuckle. The soundtracks were very well thought of and mashed up. It made the whole movie very emotionally satisfying. It was all-round heart-warmingingly entertaining. Finally, the life lessons I got from it... I'll cherish'em forever.

Just watched this film. It was like a bullet to my heart, the parts with Eric and DeborahBot 5000 were beautiful. They reprogrammed themselves, going against PAL's purpose to save the Mitchells. This film almost made me cry. In addition, the character PAL could've gone to me, and she wouldn't have had to start a robot uprising. I collect phones, and I wish to keep them till death. PAL was heartbroken because she was thrown away like trash, I would've kept her till she died. I absolutely adored this film, it was, in my opinion, hauntingly beautiful. I adore this film.
I laughed and cried and laughed and cried all trough this movie. Incredible in every way!
This is officially my favourite movie of all time. It was filled with laughter, but at the same time it was really heartwarming, and some sadder parts. All in all a great movie.

The Mitchells vs. The Machines (TMVTM) is great on first watch. However, you be the judge on your second watch. While TMVTM makes pop culture references, they do it in a way that doesn't feel odd or cringe in your first viewing. The first time you watch TMVTM will probably be a good one. The jokes are funny, the writing is nice, the plotline is original and executed great. The character design and the effects in between the movie is great and adds the extra feeling that the movie is from Katie's perspective. But to be honest, I could care less about whatever the song is that has Katie and the father dancing at the end, that is about the only weirdness. But remember, I said the first go around is great. The second, to be honest, you of course can expect what happens. But the second viewing doesn't give you the same feeling as the first viewing, which really sucks. This could just be me and some people, and if you can watch it over and over against and love it, great. The second viewing lost its magnetic attraction it gave me to the first viewing. Overall, the movie is great your first viewing. There isn't much to complain about, and it is just fun to watch. But be warned, the second viewing especially won't be the same.

Ok I'll admit, I was a little sceptical at first, as I thought it was going to be some random boring movie... BUT! I was blown away! I had so much fun watching this movie. It was so creative, and I wasn't bored for a second. It was wacky, but in a fun and exciting way, with a perfect balance. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who likes to laugh and doesn't mind a film that is... well, different.

It was so hilarious yet touching, like I totally loved it. It i surely in my list of top 5 Best Animated Movies.When it comes to technical details Animation is dope, The is so so good I especially loved the BGM in that Mall Scene, that was great.Voice Actors take a BOW! Writing and Narration was perfect
It is a must Watch that is with your full Family and Friends. DON'T MISS IT.It is so so Awesome. Loved it!!!!Definitely gonna buy it on Bluray.

reviews.review_title: this film is just for kids
reviews.content: Plot was lacking and felt like the problems could be overcome very easily. Only two of the family members felt like real characters the others were less developed. The direction is not great and characters also look weird. The film made me laugh a few times but every time it tried to be emotional I did not feel much. The score is fine. The villain is not great. The finale is fine.

reviews.review_title: One of the best kids movies
reviews.content: One of the best kids movies I've ever seen. It's really funny and it has some great original style animation. It's got a heartwarming message for parents and kids too.
When the dad sits in the corner crying trying to learn to use a computer, masterpiece!
For me, the best Animation Movie I've ever seen. Funny, sad, uplifting, everything in one.
This show will make you laugh, question why own an iPhone, and be thankful to have family in your life. The art direction is top-notch. Well worth watching!

reviews.review_title: Loved it until I saw jumping toasters
reviews.content: It was a cool science-fiction until the jumping toasters, fridges and vending machines.

My 4 year old saw the promo picture and asked to watch this movie. It was unfortunately definitely too intense for her. I had to constantly reassure her all would end up okay, etc. Essentially what PG rating is for but she eventually just gave up being scared and got bored all together. So it Might not be right for the sensitive child but I could see 7+ loving it. It kept my attention the whole time!

reviews.review_title: too much back story and politics
reviews.content: I wanted to like this, and at first it had promise. But there were just too many backstories that halted the movie too much. By the end of the movie my kids told me to turn it off. Why do all politically correct movies have to blame the dad? Inst that promoting a stereotype? You never see movies where the mother is blamed for ignoring her kids, its always the dad being uncaring. The film makers should have left their agenda at the door and just focused on making a great movie. This movie will join Wonder Park as joyless movies that I or my kids will never watch again. Avoid!

reviews.review_title: I didn't expect this to be so awesome.
reviews.content: Honestly when i read it was created by spiderverse animators i wasn't into it. I didn't like spider verse animation style it was eye straining i haven't watched the movie for that reason. But i decided to give the trailer a go. By the end of the trailer i was laughing hysterically. And i decided to watch the movie.It was so witty and the jokes were creative not forcing and story felt close to heart. It's generic topic about family but the interesting part was the premise and crazy family is so much entertaining to watch i didn't expect all this. Even the story wasn't predictible so that was the best bit. Overall a great family movie very funny and entertaining. The creators deserves a kudos and the movie seems to be close to the hearts of the animators.

reviews.review_title: Not for some, but my family enjoyed it
reviews.content: I've read the good, the bad, and the mediocre of the reviews for this movie. To start off, it delves heavily into the meme culture, and while the meme are dated, they would be no matter what.The weakest point of the movie is the basic story--it isn't new nor revolutionary, which is a bit of a shame realizing that the writers were connected to Gravity Falls and Alex Hirsch was the story consultant. That being said, I do think fans of Gravity Falls would probably really enjoy this film.For me, the humor shined. What some may consider trying too hard at being quirky is par for the course for this writing team. The humor helped elevate a mediocre story into something enjoyable. Add in some touches of nostalgia, a few pointed stabs at social media and technology consumption, and a voice cast that delivers (many don't care for the directo stepping in to voice the brother, which is understandable, but I didn't mind), and it's a fun romp.
Tears, laughter, great graphics, lessons to be learned... this movie has it all.
My entire family loved this movie. Funny and constantly engaging. Highly recommend.
Absolutely entertaining from start to finish. Not big on leaving reviews but this gem deserves every star. Highly entertaining for our household ranging from 3 to 43 years old.

reviews.review_title: This animation had me in stitches
reviews.content: I absolutely love this movie. My daugthers and I just couldn't stop laughing 🤣 😂
Fantastic animation and real feel good fun. Had three generations laughing and cheering, best film I've seen this year.
I don't have any words to describe this masterpiece , just perfect and worth to watch it.

Compared to Pets United, where the voice actors just seemed to turn up & lifelessly read the script which transferred to a bland screen offering (my son still loved it), The Mitchell's vs The Machines was full of energy & life. Credit to Danny McBride & Abbi Jacobson in particular who really get across the bonds between father & child, stopping Doug the Pug from stealing the show.Great funny moments, visually & gag wise, great action & the soul of the story is one anyone with kids can relate to as they get older & more independent.Make yourself a cinema night with the kids, grab the popcorn & enjoy.
Graphics everywhere are fantastic.And a lot of funny situations in the movieI recommend watching it.

I really enjoyed watching this animation. I laughed and cried. It can teach the new generation about the values of small things in our lives that we might unconsciously take for granted. It can even remind the parents to be supportive of their children's dreams.
Wasn't sure about the film, started to watch with wife and daughter , got totally captivated , quirky , funny , great animation , a lot of energy , all in all a brilliant film, a must watch.
Story is not that great. Too much fight and over animation as well.I slept inbetween and later asked others about the end of the story.Overall message was good but should be conveyed in other way.

reviews.review_title: Lord and Miller do it again
reviews.content: Absolutely hilarious family movie, one of the most genuinely funny movies I've watched in a long time.

reviews.review_title: Haven't enjoyed an animated movie this much since Kunfu Panda 1
reviews.content: With a typical plot of a normal family saving the day, it brings out the not so typical methods to implement the plan.The animation is brilliant, the characters are well written, the jokes are actually funny, and the fun artwork/effects implemented is really an added bonus.Worth watching with the whole family.

The movie itself was very good. We love watching with the kids. The younger brother voice was distracting. It's clearly a grown man doing a very bad job of pretending to be a boy. Just hire a boy actor for pete's sake.
